excerpts: The clam ramen is yummy, the hamachi kama and shishamo are prepared perfectly, the appetizers and the special rolls are delicious.
All the servers are attentive and professional.
This place gets full very quick, so wait time can be a bit if arrive after 6pm weekdays.
shishamo.author: Marie H.
shishamo.review: Best neighborhood gem in West Portal! we recently rediscovered Fuji and so glad we did.  Love their food!  The sashimi dishes are fresh, delicious and served with generous portions.  The clam ramen is yummy, the hamachi kama and shishamo are prepared perfectly, the appetizers and the special rolls are delicious.  All the servers are attentive and professional.  This place gets full very quick, so wait time can be a bit if arrive after 6pm weekdays.

excerpts: i think, the one with chicken yakitori and tempura, eggplant dengaku, california roll, salad, rice, and misosoup.
dengaku.author: chihiro i.
dengaku.review:
this is one of my favorite sushi joint to go.

my favorite is red and white roll, and dinner box 3 i think, the one with chicken yakitori and tempura, eggplant dengaku, california roll, salad, rice, and misosoup. aand of course with a cold one. mmmm.

Their rolls are awesome. I just looove the creativeness and oh they taste so good. my roommate never eat sushi, but she liked their rolls, that means a lot.

excerpts: I order beef gyoza.
I ask her if they pan fry it, and if not, could they cook it in an oil that hasn't been used by other fried items-
sometimes shellfish residuals from tempura stays in the oil.
Nope, they can't do that, sorry.
I'm kind of a rebel, so I took my chances and ordered it anyway.
I only got a little throat itch, so no big deal.
I also ordered chicken/vegetables on a skewer with teryaki sauce, a kappa maki roll, and one of them omelette rolls.
I also asked for a glass of water.
I suppose I should start eating fish, because they did have some pretty pictures in their little book, but I just couldn't do it.
beef gyoza.author: Pam S.
beef gyoza.review:
This could just be me, but when I go out to dinner with other yelpers, I wonder if they too are crafting their reviews in their head as we dine.  Oh, it's just me?  And I'm a big loser?  No matter, because my reviews will go down in the annals of history as some of the best reviews ever written, and it is all because I'm a big dork who tries to form sentences (not related to the conversation at hand) in her head while eating dinner with 3 other fabulous yelpers.

Moving on...

In order to get our cerebral neurons properly firing before trivia night, Ali Gator, Jessica L, Angelo, and I decided to come here and plan our strategy.  Although I'm not gaga over sushi, as I don't eat anything from the ocean that has a face, I am learning to enjoy other food at these sort of establishments, such as gyoza and cucumber rolls.  I'm also deathly allergic to shellfish, which tends to complicate matters.

Waitress comes over, we order drinks.  When I change my order from a small hot sake to a large hot sake- she says "3 Sapporos."  This statement did not instill confidence in me for the remainder of the evening, but I gave her the benefit of the doubt.  It was a Tuesday night, after all.  After a wait that was wholly unnecessary, we order our food.  I order beef gyoza.  I ask her if they pan fry it, and if not, could they cook it in an oil that hasn't been used by other fried items- sometimes shellfish residuals from tempura stays in the oil.  Nope, they can't do that, sorry.  I'm kind of a rebel, so I took my chances and ordered it anyway.  I only got a little throat itch, so no big deal.  I also ordered chicken/vegetables on a skewer with teryaki sauce, a kappa maki roll, and one of them omelette rolls.  I also asked for a glass of water.  I suppose I should start eating fish, because they did have some pretty pictures in their little book, but I just couldn't do it.  I'll let my companions explain what they ordered, as I've probably bored the reader to tears already at this point.

Moving on...

So they bring my gyoza (and I managed not to die), my kappa maki rolls and my omelette roll things.  They forgot my chicken skewer thing.  Gyoza was good, but my rolls were...not.  Granted, 99% of my sushi experience has been at Coach Sushi, so I might be a little biased because Coach and I are TIGHT, but the rolls were meh.  They were small, not that good, and fell apart, which basically topped off a mediocre experience.

Eh.

excerpts: We actually started with the beef gyoza since I was super hungry.
beef gyoza.author: Jeff P.
beef gyoza.review:
Glamor!  Style!  Swanky setting!  Award winning wine list!

Well, you won't get any of that here at Fuji.  But, what you will get is really good sushi with friendly, attentive service.

We actually started with the beef gyoza since I was super hungry.  They were light, crispy and delicious.  

The smoked salmon nigiri was amazing.  They gave us a nice thick cut of yummy, flavorful fish.  The kampachi nigiri was good too but was overshadowed by the smoked salmon.

The Tanzania roll was really tasty although I don't understand why a sushi place names a roll for an African nation.   The Finding Nemo and Double Hamachi were also excellent.

I made the mistake of ordering a glass of Sauvignon Blanc.  Really bad & very sweet.  Skip the wine and just enjoy the fish.

excerpts: Croquette: 0/5
It was runny liquefied mashed potato mix that doesn't come close to actual croquettes, it was inedible (-1 star).
Plus, they did not serve it with katsu sauce, rather some unidentifiable brown sauce with chunks of fat floating at the top.
Salad: 2/5 fresh, but they use iceberg lettuce, I may as well drink a glass of water.
Miso soup:
2/5 tastes like a shiro/aka blend, leaning more towards the shiro.
The total for the Dinner Box ($21) and the croquette was $29.95 after tax.
croquette.author: Leah C.
croquette.review:
Preface: I used to live in Japan.

Meal ordered: Dinner Box #4
Cleanliness of the restaurant: 5/5
Service: 5/5 - fast, polite, gave an accurate measure of how long it would take for the food to be prepared.
To-go packaging: 5/5

Sushi: 5/5 - spicy tuna roll
Tempura: 5/5 good variety, crisp, though the dipping sauce was not that great (it was essentially watered down soy sauce).
Yellow Tail: 4/5 a little overcooked (it was not marinaded, glazed, or seasoned).
Croquette: 0/5 It was runny liquefied mashed potato mix that doesn't come close to actual croquettes, it was inedible (-1 star). Plus, they did not serve it with katsu sauce, rather some unidentifiable brown sauce with chunks of fat floating at the top.
Salad: 2/5 fresh, but they use iceberg lettuce, I may as well drink a glass of water.
Miso soup: 2/5 tastes like a shiro/aka blend, leaning more towards the shiro. The flavor tasted like the packets you buy from the store as opposed to homemade miso.

The total for the Dinner Box ($21) and the croquette was $29.95 after tax. As far as the contents of the Dinner Box itself (purely objectively), the price is pretty average. 

As a whole, I was not particularly impressed with the food. They have a stereotypical menu and the quality is clearly hit or miss depending upon the dish. I feel like they cut *some* corners because this is SF and people here do not know what un-Americanized Japanese food tastes like (-1). Croquettes are one of my favorite sides to order at a Japanese restaurant (yes I am aware that this is not a Japanese dish, rather a French one) because the Japanese style of making croquettes is positively delicious! So when I got home and had a bite of one of the croquettes and had to question if they actually served me croquettes... I was rather irked to say the least.

If I return it will be for the sushi and the superior service only because the spicy tuna roll I had was *very* good and the wait staff was really awesome!

excerpts: Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!
A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.
sunomono.author: Belle P.
sunomono.review: This place is great!  Sushi for days and the kitchen menu is pretty extensive.  Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!  A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.

excerpts: The sunomono was good as well
sunomono.author: Mason W.
sunomono.review:
It had been a couple years since I had been to Fuji, back when I got  good sized groups of sushi fans to eat there on a few occasions.  Earlier tonight, my wife and I waited just a few minutes for perfect seats at the center of the sushi bar, right in front of the head sushi chef.  For a Friday night, the place was understandably busy.  We could see most of the other food going to other customers were a variety of maki rolls and other entrees.  Our interest was pure and simple:  nigiri, and lots of it!

The meal was surprisingly sublime.  The fish was cool, tender, fresh, and properly seasoned as appropriate, while the rice was perfectly room temperature, with the right balance of chewiness, smoothness, and subtle vinegar flavor.  We believe we were at an advantage with our close proximity to the head sushi chef.  The time from him making the nigiri to it entering our mouths could literally be measured in seconds.

Our favorites were the anago, the bonito, and the escolar, all bursting with flavor and wonderful mouth feel.  They were so good, we doubled up on those orders.  

Also good were the hotate, the kampachi, and the toro.  Less impressive, but still good, was the saba.  The hamachi sashimi was very nice.  The sunomono was good as well - I enjoyed the fresh piece of taco (octopus) from it.

The chef did comp us a special piece of toro with a nori wrap, no rice, and some sort of light color salty sauce.  That was quite nice of him.

For comparison, my wife and I commented to each other that this nigiri meal easily beat recent similar meals at Kabuto and Nagano on Geary St., and Higuma in Redwood City.  While not cheap, it was well worth the cost.

Perhaps our experience would not have been as good if we had not sat at the sushi bar, nor focused on nigiri, but since we thoroughly enjoyed this one meal, and I've had good experiences before at Fuji, I'm assigning a 5 star rating.  Choose wisely at this place for a great meal.

excerpts: Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites.
The fish quality is great, especially the salmon.
Not to mention the staff is very friendly.
I would definitely recommend.
oshitashi.author: Corinne S.
oshitashi.review: Fuji is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant that I have ever been to. I am a regular there, I go 1-3 times a week with my boyfriend and they never disappoint. Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites. The fish quality is great, especially the salmon. Not to mention the staff is very friendly. I would definitely recommend.

excerpts: Tried this place after a morning run and ordered the sashimi salad for lunch, really refreshing and light, just perfect...
My husband order a Katsu rice and it was good.
When our bill came, we were charged dinner prices, so check your bill carefully.
The waitress forgot?
sashimi salad.author: Elaine Y.
sashimi salad.review:
Tried this place after a morning run and ordered the sashimi salad for lunch, really refreshing and light, just perfect...  My husband order a Katsu rice and it was good.  When our bill came, we were charged dinner prices, so check your bill carefully.  The waitress forgot? She apologized and rectified our bill.

Will return, since it's in our neighborhood

excerpts: I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces.
Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer
: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor!

Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside...
hamachi on the outside!
No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat.
sashimi salad.author: Michelle L.
sashimi salad.review:
Delicious Japanese restaurant, but a little pricier, and prepare to wait for your food!

Favorite items were:
Korean style Chirashi: nom nom nom! Korean style basically means the fish is chopped up smaller and it came with a ton of lettuce. I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces. Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor! Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside... hamachi on the outside! No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat. Creamy avocado and sweet sauce was super flavorful as well

The OK:
Finding nemo roll - spicy tuna no the inside, salmon and avocado on the outside. decent, but not my favorite!!

Again - it takes them a while to serve you here. They seemed to have a TON of togo orders, with only 2 waitresses and 2 sushi chefs. It wasn't too crowded... but it seemed that every aspect of service dragged on.

Come here if you don't mind the wait!!

excerpts: Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!
A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.
sashimi salad.author: Belle P.
sashimi salad.review: This place is great!  Sushi for days and the kitchen menu is pretty extensive.  Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!  A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.

excerpts: The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it!
Will come back :)
sashimi salad.author: Kevin T.
sashimi salad.review: Went with my sister during their lunch break, but they still accepted us! Very social and nice workers that kept us company at the sushi bar. In addition, the food was very very good. Salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, while the liger roll had harmonious flavors (the green onion wasn't overwhelming or anything). The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it! Will come back :)

excerpts: My brother's first complaint was that the sashimi salad he'd ordered was supposed have 8 pieces of maguro-
he got 5 and the waitress told him that's how the dish is NOW-
not like it is in the menu.
Hmmm.
Have had better pre-made sushi at Paradise Market in Marin.
DO NOT order any roe nigiri, unless you want to get sick eating old, pre-packed, unfresh fish eggs.
GAMIEST Aji (Spanish Mackeral)
I've ever had-
and it was on the fresh/special list.
Yikes!
Wild salmom nigiri was not that fresh or tasty either.
Hamachi was decent-
but do you need a HUGE piece of fish laying over a tiny ball of rice??
I don't mean to complain, but the presentation is off from the get go when this happens, right?
Too bad.
Nice staff, good location, fairly brisk service.
Pretty bad sushi.
sashimi salad.author: Sean E.
sashimi salad.review:
Don't think the owner/manager knows what he's doing here. And he stands there at the end of the sushi bar watching/staring at everyone. It's kind of uncomfortable, like he's making sure you like it/ don't have complaints.
Well, I have one. Try using FRESH fish in a Japanese sushi restaurant, cheapo! I mean c'mon, who are you trying to fool? No wonder the place is half empty on a Friday night. My brother's first complaint was that the sashimi salad he'd ordered was supposed have 8 pieces of maguro- he got 5 and the waitress told him that's how the dish is NOW- not like it is in the menu. Hmmm.
Have had better pre-made sushi at Paradise Market in Marin. DO NOT order any roe nigiri, unless you want to get sick eating old, pre-packed, unfresh fish eggs. GAMIEST Aji (Spanish Mackeral) I've ever had- and it was on the fresh/special list. Yikes! Wild salmom nigiri was not that fresh or tasty either. Hamachi was decent- but do you need a HUGE piece of fish laying over a tiny ball of rice?? I don't mean to complain, but the presentation is off from the get go when this happens, right?
Too bad. Nice staff, good location, fairly brisk service. Pretty bad sushi.

excerpts: The ankimo was terrible.
ankimo.author: Athos K.
ankimo.review: Really disappointing reopening.  The service is terrible - they're either understaffed or just too slow. We ordered a lot of sashimi:  most of it was bland, some of it was actually kind of bad.  The ankimo was terrible. The special banana split roll was cold and small and didn't taste as good as before the closure (for safety concerns).  This used to be a neighborhood fave, but now I'll probably never come here again.

excerpts: I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll.
The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends.
I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love.
Be prepared for a true carb feast.
I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place!

It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed!
Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.
sashimi sampler.author: Stephanie Y.
sashimi sampler.review: Being born and raised in Seattle, I have always been blessed with great seafood -- it's practically everywhere. But ever since I've moved to San Francisco, I've been constantly on the hunt to find a new sushi restaurant that I could call my go-to. Didn't expect to find it here in West Portal! Fuji, located in a small, kitschy neighborhood, is the place that can cater to all your sushi needs. I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll. The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends. I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love. Be prepared for a true carb feast. I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place! It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed! Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.

excerpts: their sashimi was all fresh, well plated, and good.
i really loved their Toro with uni on top ( melted in my mouth with touch of truffle oil flavor).
Service was also good, friendly and fast.
i liked the waitress named 'K?'
or 'kay' a lot!!
i am not really sure her name but everything she recommended were so good.
i definitely will go back to try their Toro.
Oh, one more, their Beef teriyaki was sooooo good, too

(i don't usually order beef teriyaki when i go to Japanese restaurant because i order only nigiri and sashimi, but my friend ordered one, and i tried) their Beef teriyaki is like premium steak quality!
juicy tender and perfectly cooked.
sashimi.author: Chris L.
sashimi.review:
i visited this place long time ago ( at least 3-4years ). At that time, i loved this place because they had good selections of traditional Japanese food which were sooo good! Recently, i visited Fuji with my friends and they surprised me a lot. Now they have all traditional menu plus trendy japanese dishes too. their sashimi was all fresh, well plated, and good. i really loved their Toro with uni on top ( melted in my mouth with touch of truffle oil flavor). Service was also good, friendly and fast. i liked the waitress named 'K?' or 'kay' a lot!! i am not really sure her name but everything she recommended were so good. i definitely will go back to try their Toro. Oh, one more, their Beef teriyaki was sooooo good, too (i don't usually order beef teriyaki when i go to Japanese restaurant because i order only nigiri and sashimi, but my friend ordered one, and i tried) their Beef teriyaki is like premium steak quality! juicy tender and perfectly cooked. i highly recommend this place.

overall

food 5/5
service 5/5
price 5/5
interior (atmosphere) 2/5
location (parking) 3/5

excerpts: If you feel like splurging and love sashimi, get the Omakase platter and let the sushi chef choose a great assortment of fish for you.
sashimi.author: Angelito R.
sashimi.review:
We have been eating here since moving to Westportal. We eat sushi a lot and were absolutely surprised how good this sushi place was in a neighborhood not known to be culinarily adventurous. They have a wide variety of fish, which has always been fresh. There was a period that we ate here so many times a week it may as well have been our second kitchen.

We still eat here a lot but generally order out. The fish is always fresh. And the teriyaki dishes are also delicious. Just recently that the health scores have been low, but it's been super clean every time we've gone. If you feel like splurging and love sashimi, get the Omakase platter and let the sushi chef choose a great assortment of fish for you.

excerpts: Tons of quality sashimi, lots of veggies, and small bowl of rice.
It made me miss my moms "hwe dup bap".
I'd go back in a heartbeat just to get this dish.
My bf ordered California, Spider, and green dragon rolls and he said it was good.
sashimi.author: S Y.
sashimi.review:
I had bookmarked Fuji to try for awhile now, and I'm bummed it took me so long to try it. This review is only for my Korean style Chirashi bowl, their service, and their price.

If you know what a Korean style chirashi bowl is, then sans perila/seasame leaf, this was legit.  Tons of quality sashimi, lots of veggies, and small bowl of rice. It made me miss my moms "hwe dup bap". I'd go back in a heartbeat just to get this dish.  My bf ordered California, Spider, and green dragon rolls and he said it was good. But nothing for him to say stellar, but he'd go back for sure.

Service was little slow. There were 2 sushi men making the rolls, and at least one or two back kitchen team, but one server. Granted we went close to 2pm, or there was a waitress shortage, service could've been better.  The waitress was sweet, kind, fast. Still, no way for her to cover the entire restaurant.

Price was reasonable. It's not a deal of the century, but it was sf price tag.

I am not sure of all of low reviews, I didn't read it, I don't think it's going to change my opinion much about now our regular spot.

excerpts: The menu contains many of the greatest hits of Japanese food - donburi, sushi, sashimi, noodles, teriyaki, tempura, bento boxes, etc.
sashimi.author: Melissa L.
sashimi.review:
I first went to Fuji's years ago and thought it was okay.  The portions were generous but the food was standard Japanese fare.  

For a recent family dinner we decided to give Fuji another try.  We were quickly greater upon our entrance and seated immediately.  The menu contains many of the greatest hits of Japanese food - donburi, sushi, sashimi, noodles, teriyaki, tempura, bento boxes, etc.  We decided to order the seafood yosenabe and one of their special sushi rolls.  

The yosenabe was full of seafood - mussels, clams, imitation crab, shrimp and salmon, along with vegetables and clear noodles.   The dish was flavorful and and hot, with the seafood cooked perfectly.   I had one issue with this dish and it was that the broth left me really thirsty, even though I did not find the dish salty.

The sushi roll was as expected and was quite large, so expect to share these.

Our meals came with a green salad.

Patrons seemed to be locals from the neighborhood.  On a weekend evening the restaurant was mostly full.  We were walk-ins.  Parking was plentiful nearby.  Service was good, with our waiter checking in on us, refilling our beverages and possessing a great attitude.

Fuji is a nice option for dining in West Portal but is similar to so many other Japanese restaurants in the area.

excerpts: We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.
sashimi.author: Jacky J.
sashimi.review:
This is our neighborhood go to spot for Sushi. Every time we come here if Shannon gives us great service. We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.

There seems never to be a wait at the bar, which is what I prefer.

I was here for the Warriors playoff game and he had the game on TV. I definitely will come back here for more Giants games this season. Keep up the good work and thank you for the good service!

5 stars!!

excerpts: We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.
sashimi.author: Lee L.
sashimi.review:
This is our neighborhood go to spot for Sushi. Every time we come here if Shannon gives us great service. We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.

There seems never to be a wait at the bar, which is what I prefer.

I was here for the Warriors playoff game and he had the game on TV. I definitely will come back here for more Giants games this season. Keep up the good work and thank you for the good service!

5 stars!!

excerpts: My GF ordered beef teriyaki, and I, the sushi/sashimi combo.
And then we waited.....and waited....and waited....
She got her plate first after about 20 minutes.
I told her to start without me.
She was half way through before, yes...
I had to flag down the staff again that never checked in on us.
Finally...after another 20 minutes of waiting (so now we are at about 50 minutes since sitting)
my sushi/sashimi combo came.
The tuna sashimi was half frozen still, and the yellow tail had a slight grayish tint to it.
At this point I was starving, and ate it in 10 minutes flat.
Then..I did the unthinkable.
I ordered more food, because I was still hungry.
They had a Crab leg special
so I asked if they could provide it in a cone form, instead.
The waitress insisted that they could do it that way, but it would just be the crab and rice.
She suggested if I wanted avocados and cucumber to just get a California roll with real crab.
sashimi.author: Darren J W.
sashimi.review:
A lot of money for a lot of nothing. 
First, I am usually very picky about sushi restaurants, but I was hungry and had a craving, so I was desperate.

We were sat to the side near the front which would usually mean a good spot for service, but sadly not. 

My girlfriend and I waited for 15 minutes from being seated, and had to flag down one of many waitstaff to finally order. No acknowledgment beforehand. 
My GF ordered beef teriyaki, and I, the sushi/sashimi combo. And then we waited.....and waited....and waited....
She got her plate first after about 20 minutes. I told her to start without me.  She was half way through before, yes...I had to flag down the staff again that never checked in on us. 
Finally...after another 20 minutes of waiting (so now we are at about 50 minutes since sitting) my sushi/sashimi combo came.

And it was stingy. For a  $23 dollar combo, it was really tiny.  
The tuna sashimi was half frozen still, and the yellow tail had a slight grayish tint to it. 
At this point I was starving, and ate it in 10 minutes flat. 
Then..I did the unthinkable. I ordered more food, because I was still hungry. 
They had a Crab leg special so I asked if they could provide it in a cone form, instead. The waitress insisted that they could do it that way, but it would just be the crab and rice.  She suggested if I wanted avocados and cucumber to just get a California roll with real crab. So that's what I did. 

And I waited...and waited....and waited....occasionally flagging down any Waiter or waitress that would acknowledge me. Meanwhile everyone around our table had been served promptly through several rounds of sushi. I would get a "Yes! I will check on it!" and watch as the waiter or waitress would run back and bring more sushi to other tables...

So....25 minutes later, I finally got my crab sushi...in a cone..not a roll as suggested. 

AWFUL SERVICE. RIP OFF SUSHI. HIGH PRICES. NOT REAL JAPANESE SUSHI. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. GO TO J-TOWN AND GET THE REAL DEAL AT THESE PRICES.

excerpts: I usually have sashimi every time
and I find the fish very fresh, also the rolls are very tasty combination of fresh and cooked ingredients.
Over all a Great Neighborhood Gem.
sashimi.author: Thomas H.
sashimi.review: The service is Great here at Fuji, the food was questionable in the past but since the new management/owner reorganize and remodeled the place the quality of food improved drastically.  The menu have array of things to choose from for all different appetite from vegan to meat eater and everyone in between.  I usually have sashimi every time and I find the fish very fresh, also the rolls are very tasty combination of fresh and cooked ingredients.  Over all a Great Neighborhood Gem.

excerpts: Would go to sushi suki for sushi and sashimi instead.
sashimi.author: Di G.
sashimi.review: Was in the mood for chicken karaage. So I ordered the karaage appetizer with a bowl of rice. Very tasty and delish. My husband ordered the veggie ramen. There were barely any noodles in it which was disappointing. But when we told the waiter, he told us he would give us half off. Would have preferred a new bowl with more noodles but at least they offered to do something about it. Pretty pricey for regular items. Would go to sushi suki for sushi and sashimi instead.

excerpts: The sashimi dishes are fresh, delicious and served with generous portions.
sashimi.author: Marie H.
sashimi.review: Best neighborhood gem in West Portal! we recently rediscovered Fuji and so glad we did.  Love their food!  The sashimi dishes are fresh, delicious and served with generous portions.  The clam ramen is yummy, the hamachi kama and shishamo are prepared perfectly, the appetizers and the special rolls are delicious.  All the servers are attentive and professional.  This place gets full very quick, so wait time can be a bit if arrive after 6pm weekdays.

excerpts: Anyways, I LOVED my bento box two; came with salmon teriyaki, a decent portion of tuna and salmon sashimi (these were FAT pieces and probably one of the places I can recommend for very fresh fish), shrimp and veggie tempura, and this side of spinach with ponzu sauce.
The bento box three my mom got had two skewers of yakitori, an eggplant side, veggie tempura and california roll.
I would definitely come back for the sashimi , but maybe to-go this time.
ALSO pay cash for 10% off your bill!
sashimi.author: Kathleen S.
sashimi.review:
For the sake of how long I've been living in this area, I'm really surprised I never decided to walk into this restaurant until a few days ago. It isn't very visually appealing and can be easily missed on the corner, but once you're in it's actually pretty cozy like you're at a local cafe.

On a weekend this place was just the right amount of crowded, meaning that my sister, mom and I didn't have to wait long for a table even though there were a few parties ahead of us and people leaving the restaurant. Now onto the food; the prices overall are a little steep, but in the end it was pretty worth it for the amount of food you get. My sister got the tempura donburi, I got the dinner bento box two and my mom got the bento box three. All the dinner menu items come with miso soup and salad (PS salad dressing is yummy); bento boxes get a side of rice. We also decided to order a "Finding Nemo" roll (spicy tuna, salmon, avocado, roe) that came out way later while we were in the middle-almost end of our main dishes... I don't know if I would order both dinner items and sushi rolls if they don't come out at the same time.

Anyways, I LOVED my bento box two; came with salmon teriyaki, a decent portion of tuna and salmon sashimi (these were FAT pieces and probably one of the places I can recommend for very fresh fish), shrimp and veggie tempura, and this side of spinach with ponzu sauce. The bento box three my mom got had two skewers of yakitori, an eggplant side, veggie tempura and california roll. Both boxes were about $17-$19 which isn't too bad for what you're getting.

Downside of my experience: they weren't on top of refilling our waters or asking if everything was okay. I would definitely come back for the sashimi , but maybe to-go this time. ALSO pay cash for 10% off your bill!

excerpts: I love their sashimi here!
Always fresh tasting.
Service is a plus here they always accommodate me and check in often.
Will definitely come back for more.
sashimi.author: Elise T.
sashimi.review: I love their sashimi here! Always fresh tasting. Service is a plus here they always accommodate me and check in often. Will definitely come back for more.

excerpts: Had a craving for sashimi and sake after work one day so met up a friend at this local spot.
Hostess was polite and asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar or table.
We ordered a variety of sashimi and started off with some sake and appetizers.
Didn't have to wait long before we got our food and the presentation was amazing.
It was a work of art and more importantly the sashimi was fresh.
They were large generous cuts compared to other places.
My favorite was probably the lobster sashimi.
sashimi.author: David H.
sashimi.review:
Had a craving for sashimi and sake after work one day so met up a friend at this local spot. Hostess was polite and asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar or table. We opted for the bar because we could watch the chef prepare our order.

We ordered a variety of sashimi and started off with some sake and appetizers. Didn't have to wait long before we got our food and the presentation was amazing. It was a work of art and more importantly the sashimi was fresh. They were large generous cuts compared to other places. My favorite was probably the lobster sashimi.

You eat with your eyes first and they definitely had me there. We ended staying pretty long drinking sake afterwards. The wait staff was on point making sure we had everything we needed. 

Not sure why some of the reviews are low on this place but this place definitely is thumbs up.

excerpts: For starters, I wanted the combination box number one; teriyaki chicken/mixed tempura with a few pieces of tuna sashimi, sushi with wasabi on the side and something that are like fried wantons or pot stickers that I didn't care for and white rice.
sashimi.author: David A.
sashimi.review:
Fuji has definitely gone down hill since its reopening. I've been back here twice since and the first time back was better than the second but I went there with family members on Sunday and it was clear to me that the food and service are very much compromised; I don't even know if it's the same ownership! different cooks, waiters, everything!

For starters, I wanted the combination box number one; teriyaki chicken/mixed tempura with a few pieces of tuna sashimi, sushi with wasabi on the side and something that are like fried wantons or pot stickers that I didn't care for and white rice.

I had that specific meal on my previous trip to Fuji and thought it would be an almost perfect combination if I could get all shrimp tempura as I don't care that much for most of the vegetable except for the broccoli but love shrimp tempura. So I asked the waiter if I could get that box with all shrimp tempura, even for an additional price and he said "sure, no problem" He then took everyone else's orders as they were ready to order. I felt reassured that I would get my meal the way I wanted it and waited patiently in anticipation for my food. 

When the waiter finally arrived with the food, I saw him putting what looked like my box down at someone else's seat but saw it had mixed tempura and thought maybe they ordered the same thing as me without all shrimp. then he put her box down in front of me which was all wrong as items on both plates were in the wrong box and my all shrimp tempura missing entirely. We point out the items that were wrongly placed in each box and the waiter says "let me fix that for you" and rearranges the two boxes and I point out that I ordered all shrimp tempura with my box as it was the first thing ordered and he just kept saying "let me fix that for you" so I assumed that he was going to bring me my shrimp tempura, but just goes off attending to his other tables as I begin to eat my meal. It becomes evident to me after a while that he is not bringing any shrimp and kept passing our table without checking in to ask if we needed anything. 

I finally flagged down another waitress and explained that I had ordered all shrimp tempura with my meal and that our waiter never brought me my shrimp. She tells me that shell bring me more shrimp tempura when it didn't matter anymore. I was just about done with everything else on my plate. twenty minutes after I finished the rest of my food, she brings me "two" shrimp tempuras and I had to save a bit of my Sapporo for a good ten minutes to wash it down and not have to order another one. the original box comes with a plate of tempura with only "one" shrimp tempura and about six vegetable. I was expecting five to seven shrimp but of course my whole order was messed up. 

Aside from all of that, my teriyaki chicken wasn't very good either. the chicken tasted somewhat rubbery and I bit into two unidentifiable hard pieces that I had to spit out into a napkin and there was almost no teriyaki sauce either! just minimal on the chicken, but I have ordered teriyaki dishes many times at the previous Fuji and I was always able to mix the white rice and soak up the sauce with my rice; I have even ordered extra rice before and this time I couldn't soak up any sauce with my rice at all. We ordered a plate full of California rolls  with real crab meat to be shared and they were just okay. the miso and salad were good but that hardly redeems the mostly mediocre food and bad service.

What pisses me off is that when you go out to eat, you go out to enjoy yourself and when a waiter or whoever brings you the wrong thing, all you can think about is how they screwed up your order and you can't enjoy your meal. the first waiter should have went straight to the kitchen and explained his own mistake, the chefs mistake or any other confusion and prioritized fixing my order, but the first waiter did nothing but mislead me into thinking he would fix my order ASAP but literally did nothing to make things right. 

If it were up to me I would never go back to Fuji and find a better Japanese restaurant in the area or in San Francisco! there has to be plenty of them that are much better in San Francisco of all places, but I'm never the one to choose where we go out and eat.

excerpts: Tried this place after a morning run and ordered the sashimi salad for lunch, really refreshing and light, just perfect...
My husband order a Katsu rice and it was good.
When our bill came, we were charged dinner prices, so check your bill carefully.
The waitress forgot?
sashimi.author: Elaine Y.
sashimi.review:
Tried this place after a morning run and ordered the sashimi salad for lunch, really refreshing and light, just perfect...  My husband order a Katsu rice and it was good.  When our bill came, we were charged dinner prices, so check your bill carefully.  The waitress forgot? She apologized and rectified our bill.

Will return, since it's in our neighborhood

excerpts: I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces.
Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer
: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor!

Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside...
hamachi on the outside!
No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat.
sashimi.author: Michelle L.
sashimi.review:
Delicious Japanese restaurant, but a little pricier, and prepare to wait for your food!

Favorite items were:
Korean style Chirashi: nom nom nom! Korean style basically means the fish is chopped up smaller and it came with a ton of lettuce. I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces. Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor! Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside... hamachi on the outside! No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat. Creamy avocado and sweet sauce was super flavorful as well

The OK:
Finding nemo roll - spicy tuna no the inside, salmon and avocado on the outside. decent, but not my favorite!!

Again - it takes them a while to serve you here. They seemed to have a TON of togo orders, with only 2 waitresses and 2 sushi chefs. It wasn't too crowded... but it seemed that every aspect of service dragged on.

Come here if you don't mind the wait!!

excerpts: We ordered a lot of sashimi:  most of it was bland, some of it was actually kind of bad.
sashimi.author: Athos K.
sashimi.review: Really disappointing reopening.  The service is terrible - they're either understaffed or just too slow. We ordered a lot of sashimi:  most of it was bland, some of it was actually kind of bad.  The ankimo was terrible. The special banana split roll was cold and small and didn't taste as good as before the closure (for safety concerns).  This used to be a neighborhood fave, but now I'll probably never come here again.

excerpts: I usually do a mix of both (sweet shrimp, toro, giant clams, sashimi) and would discover an item to order the next time!
sashimi.author: Peter L.
sashimi.review:
Don't let the above one check-in fool you, I go here whenever am able to. Fresh seafood is pretty much my criteria at a Japanese restaurant and they have it. The menu is also extensive but has more familiar items if you're not adventurous. I usually do a mix of both (sweet shrimp, toro, giant clams, sashimi) and would discover an item to order the next time!

The owners put in effort considering this is a location for SF-natives - none of the constant foot traffic found elsewhere. As a result, prices tend to be higher than the average Japanese restaurant but still not wallet busting.

Very convenient to get to if you're anywhere near the southwestern part of SF. There's no need to trek all the way to other parts of the City or Japantown. There is an upstairs dining area for large groups like on birthdays. This is one of my favorite restaurants of any cuisine in the City. The extra star is for our server Shannon, and friendly Kay.

excerpts: We particularly like the combo dinners as the sashimi was fresh with 6 slices of fish, 3 salmon and 3 tuna, 2 shrimp tempuras and vegetable tempura, salmon teriyaki (combo 2), chicken teriyaki (combo 1), gyoza (combo 1) and the combos were under $20.
sashimi.author: Karen W.
sashimi.review:
Too bad this place wasn't closer to home as we need a great Japanese restaurant in my city!  I have been here several times with a family friend for lunch but this is the first time I've been here for dinner with friends.  My friend made reservations and we sat upstairs, and I didn't even know there was seating upstairs.  The portions and food were superb in my book.  But I just can't get over the ratings of this place are all over the charts, from 1-5.  I rate it a five as we ordered various dishes, hamachi appetizer, fried scallops, seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll, Combo dinner #1 and #2 and all were delicious!  We particularly like the combo dinners as the sashimi was fresh with 6 slices of fish, 3 salmon and 3 tuna, 2 shrimp tempuras and vegetable tempura, salmon teriyaki (combo 2), chicken teriyaki (combo 1), gyoza (combo 1) and the combos were under $20.  Combos come with soup, salad and rice.

Service was attentive as well and if you pay your bill in cash, you get 10% off your bill.

excerpts: Since I had already eaten sushi/sashimi for lunch, I decided to go with Bento Box Combo #4 with Gyoza, Grilled Yellowtail, Mixed Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4Dx_LtGrciojBXixDZoCvw?select=wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA#8hOI5jUQqoc3hrLiBWRQmA) and a Hamachi Nigiri (even though it was already a lot of food, I couldn't resist my favorite).
At $21.95, it's not a cheap dinner combination, but you do get a nice variety of food.
From my prior experiences, the rolls/sashimi and appetizers are probably the way to go.
Some of the rolls are pretty good and unique to them, but the rest of what I've had isn't all that special.
Nothing bad, but nothing remarkable.
Fuji is great for the neighborhood but
for that kind of money, I feel like I can spend the same on something better or get the same quality somewhere else for less.
sashimi.author: Mike L.
sashimi.review:
When I first tried Fuji's years ago, I remember thinking that the food was solid but pricey.  Since then, I've been back a handful of times and each trip has been less and less satisfying.  I don't know if it's because the food just isn't as good as it was back then, or if it's because I've found better places to go to, but my opinion of Fuji has decreased as their prices have stayed the same.

On this most recent trip, I ended up bringing my family here to grab dinner.  Since I had already eaten sushi/sashimi for lunch, I decided to go with Bento Box Combo #4 with Gyoza, Grilled Yellowtail, Mixed Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4Dx_LtGrciojBXixDZoCvw?select=wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA#8hOI5jUQqoc3hrLiBWRQmA) and a Hamachi Nigiri (even though it was already a lot of food, I couldn't resist my favorite).  At $21.95, it's not a cheap dinner combination, but you do get a nice variety of food.  While there were little things here and there that I liked, the food was mostly just okay.

Out of the bunch, the Grilled Yellowtail tasted the best to me, but it wasn't anything you can't get elsewhere.  Sadly, there wasn't anything special about the Mixed Tempura either, and the only notable about the Gyoza was how the skin was so crispy (which I liked0.  Since I'm rather indifferent when it comes to Spicy Tuna rolls, it's hard for me to say how good/bad it was, but I was impressed with how it actually had some heat behind it.  As for the Hamachi Nigiri (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4Dx_LtGrciojBXixDZoCvw?select=wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA#wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA), they were generous with the size of the cut, but I've had better (and worse).

From my prior experiences, the rolls/sashimi and appetizers are probably the way to go.  Some of the rolls are pretty good and unique to them, but the rest of what I've had isn't all that special.  Nothing bad, but nothing remarkable.  Fuji is great for the neighborhood but for that kind of money, I feel like I can spend the same on something better or get the same quality somewhere else for less.

excerpts: Plus: Sushi and Sashimi just ok - overpriced.
Tempura is greasy and vegetables are over-cooked and soggy.
Goza lacked flavor and greasy.
Chicken terriyaki:
Chicken was fatty and the teriyaki lacked substance - almost watered down and certainly not enough on the chicken.
sashimi.author: A G.
sashimi.review:
Fuji's needs a lot of help.  I will break it down as follows:

Service:  The young server could care less she seated us a dirty table without menus. We did not feel welcomed by any means.  Finally, I got up & went behind the counter and grabbed the menus.  She got the hint, and finally came to our table with a dirty gray rag and swirled around the food crumbs on the table.  Leaving us with the gross aroma of a filthy damp fungus smelling at our table. 

Cleanliness: Fuji's is simply dirty!  The tables are sticky and the chairs are sticky & dirty. The walls (next to the table) are filthy! Greasy and dry food stuck on the walls. The floors are dirty with napkins and food on the floor.
Windows are equally flithy!  Seriously, this place hasn't been cleaned or maintained well.  

Food:  Mediocre at best. Plus: Sushi and Sashimi just ok - overpriced.
Tempura is greasy and vegetables are over-cooked and soggy. Goza lacked flavor and greasy. 
Chicken terriyaki:  Chicken was fatty and the teriyaki lacked substance - almost watered down and certainly not enough on the chicken. So very weak.

Bottomline:  All of the above, give us many reasons to pause and wondered why would we ever recommend Fiji's or ever return for a meal.

excerpts: I love how they don't skimp you on the sashimi.
Got the sushi/sashimi combo, double albacore, toro, and finding nemo.
So filling for two people!
Will definitely come back!
sashimi.author: Cheryl P.
sashimi.review:
Got there at 6 and there were a few empty tables. About an hr later, the restaurant was packed! 

Anyways, pretty good sushi for the price. I love how they don't skimp you on the sashimi. Most places give thin cuts but not this place! 

Got the sushi/sashimi combo, double albacore, toro, and finding nemo. So filling for two people! Will definitely come back!

excerpts: my boyfriend got his salmon sashimi dinner set before I did and had to stare at his food for awhile while I was waiting for my food.
sashimi.author: Stephanie W.
sashimi.review:
Worst service ever. I was here again about a month ago and it still makes me mad thinking about how shitty the service was. It took like 30 minutes for me to get my food. Guess what I ordered..? ...........

.... One spicy tuna hand roll. You don't even need to cook it and it took freakin FOREVER!!!! my boyfriend got his salmon sashimi dinner set before I did and had to stare at his food for awhile while I was waiting for my food. 

I asked a waitress cuz I was getting angry and that's asking a lot from me since I'm usually nonconfrontational . And after I asked about it she brought it out. "Finally" I muttered underneath my breath while rolling my eyes. 

Water was never refilled as per my previous review. Food was great as always. Actually this is my bfs favorite sushi spot quality wise but now I shoot it down whenever he suggests it. SORRY..

excerpts: They have a wide variety of fresh sushi sashimi daily.
I love Uni and their Uni
sashimi.author: Allie S.
sashimi.review:
I've been to this place numerous times and I still find myself craving it all the time. 

The waitress here are attentive and sweet. They have a wide variety of fresh sushi sashimi daily. 
I love Uni and their Uni here is so yummy.

I would highly recommend trying the black cod and their Kumamoto oysters and their baked mussels as well. 

You already know you will be seeing me again!

excerpts: The best special occasion is because I'm craving for Sashimi !!!
Even this place alittle pricy then my other sushi joints I go too..!!
But it was worth every penny !!
sashimi.author: Crisy G.
sashimi.review: The best special occasion is because I'm craving for Sashimi !!!  Even this place alittle pricy then my other sushi joints I go too..!! But it was worth every penny !!

excerpts: Order the sashimi because it is always fresh!
My favorite roll is definitely the Dinosaur Foot
Can't find a similar roll anywhere else
sashimi.author: Crystal C.
sashimi.review: Love coming here whenever I crave sushi. It's in the west portal area but it isn't hard to find parking. Been coming here for years, the food and the staff never disappoints. Order the sashimi because it is always fresh! My favorite roll is definitely the Dinosaur Foot :) Can't find a similar roll anywhere else

excerpts: Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!
A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.
sashimi.author: Belle P.
sashimi.review: This place is great!  Sushi for days and the kitchen menu is pretty extensive.  Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!  A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.

excerpts: The sashimi is pretty on point though.
They give your nice size chunks of fish and it is nice and fresh.
The bento box was pretty good.
The only thing to complain about is that they need to go upstairs more often and refill drinks more.
The iced tea is free refills and being super cheap
I'd like someone to at least acknowledge when a drink gets low or empty and to pay attention to out of way customers.
I will definitely be going back because there are some rolls that you don't see at other places.
Of course places might make the same roll and just add one thing to change the name
but I LOVE sushi and sashimi
so I will be going back to try other rolls I haven't before like the dinosaur foot, linga roll and a few others.
Maybe take a few trips
but it's always better to go with more people to try more rolls.
They take a max of 2 credit cards with $15 min, and the 10% off is also shown on your receipt.
Guess that is a bit better than the 5% u get for credit card perks and its all the time.
It is a bit small downstairs but make reservations and you'll be fine.
Looking forward to returning.
I assume if your downstairs the service is pretty good...
we'll see for next time.
EAT ON and be well!
sashimi.author: Austin C.
sashimi.review: There is a 10% off your bill for paying cash. I would give them 5 stars if I just rated the food. If you have a larger group, we had 5 adults and 2 toddlers, they might put you upstairs and be prepared for slow service. The food as most people have commented is pretty good. Sushi rolls I wouldn't say are out of this world as its just sushi rolls. The sashimi is pretty on point though. They give your nice size chunks of fish and it is nice and fresh. The bento box was pretty good. The only thing to complain about is that they need to go upstairs more often and refill drinks more. The iced tea is free refills and being super cheap I'd like someone to at least acknowledge when a drink gets low or empty and to pay attention to out of way customers. I will definitely be going back because there are some rolls that you don't see at other places. Of course places might make the same roll and just add one thing to change the name but I LOVE sushi and sashimi so I will be going back to try other rolls I haven't before like the dinosaur foot, linga roll and a few others. Maybe take a few trips but it's always better to go with more people to try more rolls. They take a max of 2 credit cards with $15 min, and the 10% off is also shown on your receipt. Guess that is a bit better than the 5% u get for credit card perks and its all the time. It is a bit small downstairs but make reservations and you'll be fine. Looking forward to returning. I assume if your downstairs the service is pretty good...we'll see for next time. EAT ON and be well!

excerpts:
Let's say not the Sushi, for this review, its the Sashimi.

So i just do what i always do and order the Sashimi Platter.
sashimi.author: Baylon Y.
sashimi.review:
Like a fat kid who loves cake. Where in this scene, I'm the fat kid (Which I am) and the cake is the Sushi. I the fat kid has devoured the cake. Down to the last icing. 

Let's say not the Sushi, for this review, its the Sashimi.

I'm lazy as f@#k. So i just do what i always do and order the Sashimi Platter. 

MOst places usually you can't go wrong with it since almost every Japanese establishments have their sushi bar. To me...it helps me figure out the quality of their selection, food supplier and tells me how this very establishment does business. 

Ready? 

Fresh, Slippery and delicious..

Wait what chu mean breh?

Most japanese restaurants ive had the pleasure to dine in usually doesn't blow me away, I mean in fact usually I just eat the damn thing and go, "mmm, Okay"

This time i went "Holy jesus balls this is fresh."

Am I making this up? No, maybe i got lucky with a fresh batch they just got today...

Came back another week later...

MMmmhm...nope still tastes the same as i remember. That's great right?

NO WRONG! THAT SHOULDN'T BE THE CASE!!!

but it is. and I enjoyed it.

Sharon who was serving me the day I was there the first day has a very nice smile and makes you want to order A LOT. 

Lady, please stop talking with your sweet delicious words. I'm going to die from eating too much Japanese food.

Am I a foodie? not really, I just like to eat but usually the places that make me go wow? Sold.

#i'mnotbullshittingpleasegotryit.

excerpts: Strongly recommend their deluxe sashimi.
The deco is pretty and fish is really fresh, definitely high quality.
Wait steff was very attentive and friendly.
She answers all questions about menu, sake and different types of sashimi.
It was very helpful.
Definitely come back here as usual!!!
sashimi.author: Hy K.
sashimi.review:
Came here many times with friends. I'm always happy to come to fuji. Every roll and dish is really good. Strongly recommend their deluxe sashimi. The deco is pretty and fish is really fresh, definitely high quality.
Wait steff was very attentive and friendly. She answers all questions about menu, sake and different types of sashimi. It was very helpful. 
Definitely come back here as usual!!!

excerpts: The food was really good and the sashimi was really fresh.
sashimi.author: Derek T.
sashimi.review:
I came here a couple days ago with a friend. It was my probably my fourth time eating here. 

The food was really good and the sashimi was really fresh. My favorite rolls are the Liger and the Dinosaur Foot.

Service was amazing. The staff is really friendly and attentive, even the people who cut the fish!

excerpts: The quality of the food, especially the fish (sushi and sashimi,) is top notch.
Their lunch time bento is what a bento should be.
Generous portions, good taste, fresh quality, and decent price.
Their rolls, although a bit expensive (compared to other Korean owned Japanese restaurants,) are delicious, big, well made, and satisfying.
(Dragon Roll=A+.
Chicken teriyaki/nigiri sushi two item lunch combo (#B set) is the bomb!!
The restaurant is not that big and a bit busy at lunch time, and since this is a normal upper middle class residential area, this place is relatively "hipster free.
(if that's okay with you!)
sashimi.author: George F.
sashimi.review: Folks this place is the "gold standard" for a neighborhood Japanese restaurant. The quality of the food, especially the fish (sushi and sashimi,) is top notch. Their lunch time bento is what a bento should be. Generous portions, good taste, fresh quality, and decent price. Their rolls, although a bit expensive (compared to other Korean owned Japanese restaurants,) are delicious, big, well made, and satisfying. (Dragon Roll=A+. Chicken teriyaki/nigiri sushi two item lunch combo (#B set) is the bomb!! The restaurant is not that big and a bit busy at lunch time, and since this is a normal upper middle class residential area, this place is relatively "hipster free. " (if that's okay with you!)

excerpts: Of course, he had the chicken teriyaki bento box and offloaded the salmon and tuna sashimi and the shrimp tempura on me.
The salmon and tuna sashimi was okay.
Not the freshest I've had, but it was okay.
sashimi.author: Mi M.
sashimi.review:
I feel bad writing a two-star review as my non-fish-eating Boo brought me here as a treat. Of course, he had the chicken teriyaki bento box and offloaded the salmon and tuna sashimi and the shrimp tempura on me. 

I ordered my usual litmus test sushi food as follows:

Agedashi tofu - mediocre. Over-cooked and lying in a puddle of juice - no bonito, no daikon, a little red ginger. Chipped dish. Needed a spoon too. Fail.

Ikura - good and fresh. Win.

Amaebi - didn't seem too fresh, and they tried to disguise the fact with some tobiko on to. Fried heads were overcooked. Fail.

Sea trout - lovely. Win. (It was the special, so it should have been fresh!)

Natto - Win just because they had it. It was pretty good. 

The salmon and tuna sashimi was okay. Not the freshest I've had, but it was okay. The shrimp tempura was good. 

The service was friendly but a little slow - good thing we weren't in a hurry or anything - but it took them a good 10 minutes to take our order and another 5 minutes to bring drinks. I don't mind slow service if I have a drink in front of me - it was Friday night after all!

I peeked at the bill and it seemed kind of high for what we had.

excerpts: Went to this place for the first time this week, the food was delicious the restaurant itself gives off a very warm ambiance which I appreciated, their sashimi is fresh and their cooked products are tasty .
Staff was friendly
I will definitely be coming back
sashimi.author: Yoshi Y.
sashimi.review: Went to this place for the first time this week, the food was delicious the restaurant itself gives off a very warm ambiance which I appreciated, their sashimi is fresh and their cooked products are tasty . Staff was friendly I will definitely be coming back

excerpts: Salmon sashimi was delicious.
49er roll was also delicious other than the fact that it was poorly rolled so when I picked it up, it fell apart.
Wouldn't recommend the udon, it was bland, lacked flavor and boring.
Bento box w/chicken teriyaki, tempura, gyoza and sashimi was good.
sashimi.author: Meuy S.
sashimi.review:
Salmon sashimi was delicious. 49er roll was also delicious other than the fact that it was poorly rolled so when I picked it up, it fell apart. 
Wouldn't recommend the udon, it was bland, lacked flavor and boring.
Bento box w/chicken teriyaki, tempura, gyoza and sashimi was good.

excerpts: but overall i still would recommend this place sashimi is worth it!
We ordered a good bottle of sake this time, but even taking that out of the bill, the sushi was still about $90 for two of us for thee rolls and an assorted sashimi.
sashimi.author: William N.
sashimi.review:
I've eaten here a number of times and always found it to be good fresh sushi.  Not sure if i wasn't paying as much attention previously, or if the prices went up, but I was surprised how expensive if was this past time.  We ordered a good bottle of sake this time, but even taking that out of the bill, the sushi was still about $90 for two of us for thee rolls and an assorted sashimi.  

I enjoy that they serve the sake in a wood bowl.  The wood enhances the sake and makes it fun.

I'll probably go back again, but I'm going to watch the bill more closely next time.

excerpts: Salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, while the liger roll had harmonious flavors (the green onion wasn't overwhelming or anything).
The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it!
Will come back :)
sashimi.author: Kevin T.
sashimi.review: Went with my sister during their lunch break, but they still accepted us! Very social and nice workers that kept us company at the sushi bar. In addition, the food was very very good. Salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, while the liger roll had harmonious flavors (the green onion wasn't overwhelming or anything). The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it! Will come back :)

excerpts: Sashimi is ok fresh, but the sushi rice is disappointing.
sashimi.author: Saran R.
sashimi.review:
Food was meh. Sashimi is ok fresh, but the sushi rice is disappointing. The rice texture lacks the vinegar taste and is somewhat too hard. 

Grilled Miso Gindara was small and not warm when served. There are plenty of Americanized rolls to choose from in the menu. The highlight of the meal for me is Hokkaido Hotate which is fresh and tasty.

excerpts: We were dissapointed with the sashimi though (only about 4 types of fish selection I expected more for $20 or so).
Downstairs ambience  is good, but upstairs is like an old attic--very dark upstairs and seriously need a simple remodel/paint job and getting rid of all the junk and the old shelves against the wall.
Also, they automatically add 20% tip into the bill--and this is not a high-end restaurant and their service is not like superb.
They should let customers decide how much to tip.
sashimi.author: tomcat f.
sashimi.review: Came here with a party of 7.  This place is good for sushi rolls--they are big and the thickness of the fish on the rolls are generous compared to other sushi restaurants.  We were dissapointed with the sashimi though (only about 4 types of fish selection I expected more for $20 or so).  Downstairs ambience  is good, but upstairs is like an old attic--very dark upstairs and seriously need a simple remodel/paint job and getting rid of all the junk and the old shelves against the wall.  Also, they automatically add 20% tip into the bill--and this is not a high-end restaurant and their service is not like superb.  They should let customers decide how much to tip.

excerpts: :-X Sashimi, delicious, fresh, and not lukewarm.
Big rolls = not that big
but it's very filling and full of good flavor.
Maki rolls = delicious and not mushy seaweed.
My favorite handroll, the spicy scallop, passed the test here.
Not too creamy, nor covered in bajillion spices...and delicious silky scallop, raw.
sashimi.author: Fannie S.
sashimi.review:
Service = efficient.
Decor = simple.  
Food = delicious.  Can't believe in my decade in SF, I never ventured in here... lol Even though God knows I remember waiting for the train across from it........:-X Sashimi, delicious, fresh, and not lukewarm.   Big rolls = not that big but it's very filling and full of good flavor.  Maki rolls = delicious and not mushy seaweed. My favorite handroll, the spicy scallop, passed the test here. Not too creamy, nor covered in bajillion spices...and delicious silky scallop, raw. :D

Prices = you get what you pay for here.  I was pretty happy with my experience here...give it a whirl!  And it seems to be a popular place for families (with children.)

excerpts: Their sashimi in the bento is thick cut and super fresh!
sashimi.author: Juliane N.
sashimi.review:
Love, love, LOVEE Fuji's in West Portal! Very welcoming and friendly from the moment you step in the door until you leave. Everyone that works here is very nice and attentive to your needs. And best yet, very fresh fish!

My favorite thing to order at Fuji's, and it's a must order, would be the Dinosaur Foot! It is prepared with spicy tuna red onion, tobiko, eel sauce, honey mayo all on top of a deep fried mint leaf. Trust me, you'll love!

We also enjoy their Beef Teriyaki. Unlike some other Japanese restaurants who over cooked their beef way too much, Fuji's serves some of the best beef teriyaki I've tried. It's very tender and juicy. You can choose how you want it cooked. Others don't even give you the option of letting them know how you like your meat. Their chicken teriyaki is also a good option to go for if you're not a beef kinda person. 

Sushi rolls I love to order from here are as follow.
Liger - Shrimp tempura, salmon, shrimp, avocado, and honey mustard/mayo
Finding Nemo - Salmon and avocado over spicy tuna
Omega 3 - Tuna, Salmon, Escolar, with ponzu sauce
and of course, the Dinosaur Foot!! 

Their bento options are also very affordable and they definitely do not skimp on their portions. Their sashimi in the bento is thick cut and super fresh!

Definitely give Fuji's a shot if you haven't yet. (Dinosaur Foot!)

excerpts: I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll.
The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends.
I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love.
Be prepared for a true carb feast.
I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place!

It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed!
Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.
sashimi.author: Stephanie Y.
sashimi.review: Being born and raised in Seattle, I have always been blessed with great seafood -- it's practically everywhere. But ever since I've moved to San Francisco, I've been constantly on the hunt to find a new sushi restaurant that I could call my go-to. Didn't expect to find it here in West Portal! Fuji, located in a small, kitschy neighborhood, is the place that can cater to all your sushi needs. I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll. The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends. I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love. Be prepared for a true carb feast. I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place! It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed! Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.

excerpts: The good:  Fresh, well-made sushi and sashimi.
The cooked dishes are standard, not outstanding but well prepared.
Great list of Sakes and Shochus, moderate pricing.
Some of the waitresses are really pretty, in case you care about that!
sashimi.author: charles h.
sashimi.review:
Actually Korean-owned, but the Koreans take this stuff as seriously as the Japanese do.  

So, if you've read my other reviews, you know I don't go for garbage in my sushi (ie., no mayonnaise please, no ham, pineapple or other stuff that doesn't belong there).  

The good:  Fresh, well-made sushi and sashimi.   The cooked dishes are standard, not outstanding but well prepared.  Great list of Sakes and Shochus, moderate pricing.  Some of the waitresses are really pretty, in case you care about that!  The guys behind the counter are friendly, if you sit at the Sushi bar.

The bad:  A lot of people have focused on stuff like the Dinosaur foot.  I consider that stuff garbage, and wouldn't order it.   Generally, Japanese restaurants that do that kind of crap are bad at the real thing.  In this case, just ignore it and order the real thing. My experience has been fine.  

Usually crowded, but if you are there at a less busy time the service is good.

excerpts: sashimi atop a HUGE bed of shredded green leaf and spring mix lettuces drizzled with sesame oil.
There was a little mound of rice under the lettuce.
sashimi.author: Jacquee P.
sashimi.review:
We ordered a bunch of stuff that was okay. I ordered the Korean-style chirashi because I wanted to see what it would look like. It's little cubes of (leftover?) sashimi atop a HUGE bed of shredded green leaf and spring mix lettuces drizzled with sesame oil. There was a little mound of rice under the lettuce. You're supposed to mix it up like bibimbop with hot sauce but there is SO MUCH lettuce that it's too messy to do the mix. 

The raw kumamoto oysters were amazing! They come out pre-flavored with a dot of sauce. Add a little lemon and OMG it was perfect.

excerpts: Sashimi wise:
fish was  not fresh and  flaked apart.
No flavor.
Rice.
sashimi.author: john d.
sashimi.review:
Went 18 months later, just as poor a time as last time. Rushed and uninvolved service. Entree brought five minutes before appetizer. Consistency a virtue only where the results are good, had the terrible mussels which were consistent with the terrible mussels I had last time. 

Sashimi wise:  fish was  not fresh and  flaked apart. No flavor. Rice. Not enjoyable.

Very very expensive.very.

Why do Koreans think it is enjoyable to hear them mumble Japanese to entering diners?

excerpts: I had the beef teriyaki with sashimi bento box.
The food was good and I got two slivers each of salmon and tuna sashimi.
sashimi.author: Jason C. J.
sashimi.review:
I was here for a SUPER DUPER SALTY lunch today.. X_X

Ordered some tea and it never came. I think the waitress just ignored my request or didn't hear me. Get a hearing aid woman!

I had the beef teriyaki with sashimi bento box. The food was good and I got two slivers each of salmon and tuna sashimi. The wasabi tasted like it was fresh out of the tube.

The miso soup was SUPER DUPER SALTY. It was like drinking a liquidated salt cube..ugh..

The last few times was alright, but this place didn't live up to my lunch expectations. 

Enough said about Fuji.

excerpts: The best sashimi in San Francisco!
Yes
I know that's a big call, but it's true.
Every couple of weeks we drive to West Portal only to visit Fuji and eat the Sashimi.
The side salad has an incredible green dressing.
I would buy bottles of it.
Great value for money.
Staff are not intrusive.
If you love Japanese food, you must try this place!
sashimi.author: Amy M.
sashimi.review: The best sashimi in San Francisco! Yes I know that's a big call, but it's true. Every couple of weeks we drive to West Portal only to visit Fuji and eat the Sashimi. The side salad has an incredible green dressing. I would buy bottles of it. Great value for money. Staff are not intrusive. If you love Japanese food, you must try this place!

excerpts: We had the hamachi sashimi and finding nemo.
I thought both tasted a bit off like they were recently defrosted.
It just doesn't seem right when you bite into hamachi and it breaks apart right away.
To me, it should be a little chewy -- it should kiss you back.
sashimi.author: Chris W.
sashimi.review:
Haven't been to this place in many years.  I used to go here to get the live uni.  It was the best I've ever had.  Had a craving for it, so decided to go there.  Since it was a long time ago since I last went there, we decided to call ahead to make sure they still had live uni.  They said they did, so we got there in about 15 minutes.  We placed our order, and then a few minutes later the waitress came back and said they were out.  I was incredulous.  It was 6PM on a Friday.  How could they have run out so quickly?  They said this other table ordered the last one.  I felt like walking out, but we had already placed our initial order for other food.  

When we called, they should have told us that there was only one left.  There was no indication at all that there was any scarcity.  If a customer calls you asking if you have a specific thing and you don't have it when they get there within a reasonable time, that's bad customer service.

When I first had the craving to go there, we were about 40 minutes away.  We detoured specifically to go to Fuji for the uni and were extremely disappointed at their deception.

In terms of actual food we were able to eat, I thought it was just okay.  We had the hamachi sashimi and finding nemo.  I thought both tasted a bit off like they were recently defrosted.  It just doesn't seem right when you bite into hamachi and it breaks apart right away.  To me, it should be a little chewy -- it should kiss you back.

excerpts: every couple of weeks and the one thing which sticks out to me (aside from the excellent service) is the freshness of the sashimi.
Also, they have an awesome sake menu!
sashimi.author: Patrick F.
sashimi.review: I've been eating here for almost 3 years and I can honestly say that I have never had poor service. I go here with my girlfriend every couple of weeks and the one thing which sticks out to me (aside from the excellent service) is the freshness of the sashimi. Also, they have an awesome sake menu!

excerpts: its 7 nigiri pieces followed by sashimi.
i was FULL.
from japo food.
FULL for $22 bucks.
sashimi.author: Doug ..
sashimi.review:
really good japanese food from korean people. 
get the sushi combination.  its 7 nigiri pieces followed by sashimi.  i was FULL. from japo food. FULL for $22 bucks. and it was delicious. 

get there early... we went there on friday at 530 and it was packed.

excerpts: Our sushi/sashimi platter was sub-par.
The white fish didn't taste so fresh.
3 rolls, 1 sashimi/sushi platter + 1 beer cost $67.
sashimi.author: Alias A.
sashimi.review:
Place is pretty good, with innovative though predictably creamy rolls, and fish outside of tuna could stand to be more fresh.

I tried the Dinosaur Foot based on recommendations.  It was so good - but decadent.  *Fried* leaf, with spicy tuna mixed with *creamy* sauce.  

The Godzilla's distinction is based on 1) tempura-fried asparagus 2) sriracha sauce and 3) fried garlic slices 

Double albacore roll is good but last time I had it there was way too much sauce (eel sauce + honey mayo).  I'd get it on the side if you can.  

Our sushi/sashimi platter was sub-par.  The white fish didn't taste so fresh.  Yellowtail, tuna and salmon were great though.  

3 rolls, 1 sashimi/sushi platter + 1 beer cost $67. 

Nice aura.  Run by Koreans.  

I'll be back.

excerpts: Delicious rolls and sashimi..not to mention their teriyaki chicken and beef are super tender!
The staff are super friendly and helpful as well!
sashimi.author: Karen T.
sashimi.review: Loveeeee this place! One of the best sushi restaurant in the neighborhood. Superb presentation and quality. Delicious rolls and sashimi..not to mention their teriyaki chicken and beef are super tender! The staff are super friendly and helpful as well!

excerpts: For sashimi, they don't stand out.
(I am spoiled by fish market sushi from Hokkaido, Japan).
Others have mention about the price.
Fuji is indeed pricier compared to others; however, I feel the sushi rolls are very consistent
and I know I can have a good time in the restaurant.
sashimi.author: Steven M.
sashimi.review:
One of my favorite sushi places in the neighborhood.  The many different types of roll are both pleasant to the eyes and tasty to the mouth.  I have only been here for dinner, so I haven't tried their set items on the menu.

For sashimi, they don't stand out.  (I am spoiled by fish market sushi from Hokkaido, Japan).  Others have mention about the price.  Fuji is indeed pricier compared to others; however, I feel the sushi rolls are very consistent and I know I can have a good time in the restaurant.

excerpts: Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites.
The fish quality is great, especially the salmon.
Not to mention the staff is very friendly.
I would definitely recommend.
sashimi.author: Corinne S.
sashimi.review: Fuji is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant that I have ever been to. I am a regular there, I go 1-3 times a week with my boyfriend and they never disappoint. Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites. The fish quality is great, especially the salmon. Not to mention the staff is very friendly. I would definitely recommend.

excerpts: I ordered the sashimi combo, and she ordered the chirashi.
That way we can have a comparison between the two since those are items I usually like to order.
The sashimi set had 12 pieces consisting of three each of tuna, salmon, and yellowtail.
It was pretty standard.
The fish was quite fresh and delicious.
Her chirashi made me envious though because it was highlighted by a large shrimp with the head still there.
It looked like a large amaebi (the sweet shrimp), one of my favorite at some places.
The rest of the chirashi was nicely presented also.
