It's nice....a quiet, subdued clientele adds to the consolation that everyone around you is going to have just as uneventful an evening.

Prices are reasonable too....I usually get three rolls and a Kirin. After the tip, I've still got change from a twenty towards my first round at Portals Tavern down the street.  The rolls I get are...well, rolls.  It's hard to do anything too terribly out of the ordinary with California, Tuna, and Unagi Makis.  I took my friend Tassie here once....she got some outrageously monstrous roll concocted out of a cacophony of stuff.  She's a bit more clued into the Sushi thing, and said it was a lot better than average.

Looking for a quiet place to eat and hang?  I say check it out.  If you see me sitting at the sushi bar relishing my solitude while lost in introspective thought, don't be afraid to say hi.  But if you see me at Portals Tavern an hour later, mention you saw this review and I'll buy you a beer!

excerpts: The server took random orders from us all flying from all directions and got everything on the table except a few Unagi's and Salmon orders didn't make it.
unagi.author: Tony U.
unagi.review:
Went to my good buddy ArtD's birthday party yesterday.  What a fun Japanese Restaurant to eat at.  The server took random orders from us all flying from all directions and got everything on the table except a few Unagi's and Salmon orders didn't make it.

They have lots of napkins and they gave us two complimentary beers as a reward for as all being discreet, old lushes.

It was one of the best get togethers I've been to this year.  Better late in the year than never.

The Nabayeki Udon was different in that it had Salmon in the broth.  I enjoyed it though the noodles seemed slimier than normal.  But I liked it.

The place offers Toro, my favorite order.  It's good but not as good as my favorite sushi places.

Because I had a great time, the food was good, and the service reliable, I'm going to give this 3.5 stars with a liberal bump up to 4 stars.

I'd definitely come here again.

excerpts: At Fuji, you're coming for the crazy bells and whistles, and patrons who just want some tuna or unagi might feel like this place is a bit hit-or-miss.
unagi.author: Michael D.
unagi.review: Fuji is surprising, mainly because their specialty rolls feel like culinary achievements in and of themselves.  Their Dinosaur Foot seems like a prehistoric jungle of things that crunch and ooze, but the restaurant doesn't always execute simple dishes nearly as well.  At Fuji, you're coming for the crazy bells and whistles, and patrons who just want some tuna or unagi might feel like this place is a bit hit-or-miss.

excerpts: Again, the prices seemed higher than last time I was there ($7 for 2pcs Unagi, $7.5 for 3 pieces of oysters etc).
But I wanted to treat my wife
so we ordered quite a bit of food.
As I always do in any Japanese restaurant, I asked for extra ginger because I just love it.
But when I saw the check I was annoyed: they charged $2 for the ginger.
I am never ever charged for extra ginger in any Japanese restaurant.
I complained to the waitress
but they didn't care.
unagi.author: Mike O.
unagi.review:
Never again... 

This was one of the places I used to go pretty frequently. Not the best environment, nor friendly and welcoming atmosphere, but overall it was OK because of the food quality. Lately I realized that the prices started going up every time I went there. But I was still OK with it as long as it wasn't too pricey. 

We went there tonight with my wife. Again, the prices seemed higher than last time I was there ($7 for 2pcs Unagi, $7.5 for 3 pieces of oysters etc). But I wanted to treat my wife so we ordered quite a bit of food. As I always do in any Japanese restaurant, I asked for extra ginger because I just love it. But when I saw the check I was annoyed: they charged $2 for the ginger. I am never ever charged for extra ginger in any Japanese restaurant. I complained to the waitress but they didn't care. Not even an explanation.

Yes, $2 is not a big amount, especially considering I paid over $100 for both my wife and myself. But as a matter of principle, I will never go to this restaurant again. The fact that they charged me this amount where it is free everywhere else drew the line for me (even green tea is complimentary in most Japanese restaurants but not in here). 

They lost a good customer because of their $2-pathetic-greediness.

excerpts: If you like salmon, unagi, tempura, and all the fixings in one bite, look no further, favorite roll in SF.
Favorite Japanese restaurant outside S.F, gotta go to Mikuni in and around Sacramento/Roseville, Ca.
unagi.author: Ignace P.
unagi.review: I give this place 5 stars because it has my favorite roll in the city.....the Liger. If you like salmon, unagi, tempura, and all the fixings in one bite, look no further, favorite roll in SF. Favorite Japanese restaurant outside S.F, gotta go to Mikuni in and around Sacramento/Roseville, Ca.

excerpts: The items that stood out most for me were the unagi (warm and tender), sashimi (loved the salmon) and a specialty roll that was not on the regular menu.
unagi.author: Art D.
unagi.review:
On my first visit here we rolled 11 deep and the staff took care of us with no problems whatsoever! They even hooked us up with a few complimentary large beers (we dropped some serious coin for dinner), which was unexpected and a nice touch...

We ordered all kinds of food and drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and nothing was forgotten...of course, the staff had nothing to do with the instance when one of my friends' orders was eaten by another friend, but that's another story... :-)

They seated us in the upstairs room and went to the trouble to set up and aim three fans at our table, just in case we were getting too hot battling over the tasty pieces of sushi that were being delivered to our table.

The items that stood out most for me were the unagi (warm and tender), sashimi (loved the salmon) and a specialty roll that was not on the regular menu. The spicy tuna I ordered was also tasty...

Overall the staff was very friendly and accommodating, the food was great and the prices were fair. Definitely a place that I'll get back to, especially since it's close to my 'hood!

excerpts: The unagi was over cooked, but the uni was good.
unagi.author: Sun-Kai P.
unagi.review:
The sushi was fresh, rolls were ok and that sums up the food. For the price that we paid I've had better. The service was very good, the waitress couldn't stop smiling the whole night.

The unagi was over cooked, but the uni was good.

excerpts: For example I was surprised at how big the unagi was, not your typical little slice.
Tried one of their house special rolls which was the "Looking 4 a Mango" and to my surprise
it was delicious.
(shrimp tempura inside with tuna and mango outside)
Also tried their
Bagel roll which is basically their version of the Philadelphia roll but bigger!
Place is also kid friendly because they even have special plastic cups for the kids.
No complaints with the service either.
Would give it another star if it wasn't for the price.
unagi.author: WinnJess E.
unagi.review: We're always looking for a new place to try sushi at rather than our regular go to place.  It was a little pricey but the portion sizes are pretty big. For example I was surprised at how big the unagi was, not your typical little slice.    Tried one of their house special rolls which was the "Looking 4 a Mango" and to my surprise it was delicious. (shrimp tempura inside with tuna and mango outside) Also tried their  Bagel roll which is basically their version of the Philadelphia roll but bigger!  Place is also kid friendly because they even have special plastic cups for the kids.  No complaints with the service either.  Would give it another star if it wasn't for the price.

excerpts: I think we ordered the Rainbow Roll, the Unagi Roll, and one more that I can't remember.
It was plenty for the two of us and it tasted good.
That's all you can really ask for.
We were there around 6pm and there wasn't wait, but there was definitely a wait by the time we left around 8pm.
unagi.author: Kris L.
unagi.review: I had dinner here about a month ago on a Wednesday night with a co-worker of mine.  We were in the mood for Japanese and, apparently, he frequents Fuji a lot.  We spent a lot of time chatting so every time the waitress came to take our order, we weren't ready yet.  We didn't order too much from what I remember.  I think we ordered the Rainbow Roll, the Unagi Roll, and one more that I can't remember.  It was plenty for the two of us and it tasted good.  That's all you can really ask for.  We were there around 6pm and there wasn't wait, but there was definitely a wait by the time we left around 8pm.

excerpts: The unagi roll and katsudon are some of the best I've ever tasted, and I love to wash it down with some imported Ginger ale.
Yum!!!
Unfortunately the service keeps me from giving this place five stars.
I am a very patient person, but I often feel I have to wait for an eternity just to get a glass of water.
The ambience feels very nice, food is delicious, service understaffed.
unagi.author: Christian C.
unagi.review: Absolutely supurb sushi!! If I could afford it I would eat here everyday. The unagi roll and katsudon are some of the best I've ever tasted, and I love to wash it down with some imported Ginger ale. Yum!!! Unfortunately the service keeps me from giving this place five stars. I am a very patient person, but I often feel I have to wait for an eternity just to get a glass of water. The ambience feels very nice, food is delicious, service understaffed.

excerpts: the unagi was huge, tender and delicious.
the sea bass had a great slightly chewy consistency and great flavor (i like the sturdier fish, so
i like chewy).
the hamachi was ok.
not the best i've had, but not the worst.
the toro (i.e. our dessert) was pretty good.
unagi.author: eliza w.
unagi.review:
my friends love this place (like on a first-name basis with the sushi chefs kinda thing). me, i think it's good, and a fine place to fill up on on fish and sake and beers. (while reading, remember i'm a bit of a sushi snob. so take it all with a grain of salt...and perhaps a shot of sake).

the best thing about my most recent visit? discovering that my friend kf is as much of a sushi freak as i am. this could be an expensive discovery...  

kf wasn't impressed by the amaebi, but it seemed fine to me--no old oil flavor, nice and hot and crispy. oh and the raw bit? eh, i'm always more interested in the fried bit (is that sacrilegious?). 

the unagi was huge, tender and delicious. the sea bass had a great slightly chewy consistency and great flavor (i like the sturdier fish, so i like chewy). the hamachi was ok. not the best i've had, but not the worst. the toro (i.e. our dessert) was pretty good. not to die for, but a nice finish.

the escolar was too cold. yep, frigid. i started to inhale it, was dismayed to notice the chill coming off the fish onto my teeth, and put it down to reach room temp. at which point it was lovely--good flavor, nice texture...

the uni (my first try at uni! i'm hooked!) was good. nice oceany flavor, definitely mushy, not knowledgeable enough to know if this was super fresh, but i'll definitely learn more as soon as i can.

our friend got a couple of the rolls...i wasn't tempted by any of them. there was one that had banana--heard it was a bit sweet, and might've been better as a desert. the sake was quite nice, and the service was friendly and efficient (yeeeah to my peeps).

next time i'm out drinking in the castro with kf, i'd definitely hop on muni to get a sushi fix in west portal...

excerpts: We had the beef sukiyaki and the una tem roll (shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado) and the bagel roll (philly cheese and salmon).
All of the food was very tasty and beautifully presented.
The server was super nice and the owner came over to make sure our dinner was nice.
The restaurant is clean and very warm.
We had all this and a tall kirin for $54.
unagi.author: Brian L.
unagi.review: We had the beef sukiyaki and the una tem roll (shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado) and the bagel roll (philly cheese and salmon).  All of the food was very tasty and beautifully presented.  The server was super nice and the owner came over to make sure our dinner was nice.  The restaurant is clean and very warm.  We had all this and a tall kirin for $54.

excerpts: Our favorites were the anago, the bonito, and the escolar,
all bursting with flavor and wonderful mouth feel.
anago.author: Mason W.
anago.review:
It had been a couple years since I had been to Fuji, back when I got  good sized groups of sushi fans to eat there on a few occasions.  Earlier tonight, my wife and I waited just a few minutes for perfect seats at the center of the sushi bar, right in front of the head sushi chef.  For a Friday night, the place was understandably busy.  We could see most of the other food going to other customers were a variety of maki rolls and other entrees.  Our interest was pure and simple:  nigiri, and lots of it!

The meal was surprisingly sublime.  The fish was cool, tender, fresh, and properly seasoned as appropriate, while the rice was perfectly room temperature, with the right balance of chewiness, smoothness, and subtle vinegar flavor.  We believe we were at an advantage with our close proximity to the head sushi chef.  The time from him making the nigiri to it entering our mouths could literally be measured in seconds.

Our favorites were the anago, the bonito, and the escolar, all bursting with flavor and wonderful mouth feel.  They were so good, we doubled up on those orders.  

Also good were the hotate, the kampachi, and the toro.  Less impressive, but still good, was the saba.  The hamachi sashimi was very nice.  The sunomono was good as well - I enjoyed the fresh piece of taco (octopus) from it.

The chef did comp us a special piece of toro with a nori wrap, no rice, and some sort of light color salty sauce.  That was quite nice of him.

For comparison, my wife and I commented to each other that this nigiri meal easily beat recent similar meals at Kabuto and Nagano on Geary St., and Higuma in Redwood City.  While not cheap, it was well worth the cost.

Perhaps our experience would not have been as good if we had not sat at the sushi bar, nor focused on nigiri, but since we thoroughly enjoyed this one meal, and I've had good experiences before at Fuji, I'm assigning a 5 star rating.  Choose wisely at this place for a great meal.

excerpts: Their ocean trout is good, and again, not as good.
ocean trout.author: AhLin C.
ocean trout.review:
when you've had really good sushi, nothing can really top it.  After Oyaji, I found Fuji really lacking.  Their toro was good, but not as good.  Their ocean trout is good, and again, not as good.  

There are a lot of rolls and it's quite inventive, w/ some names like Linger Roll and Finding Nemo roll, but they all taste only ok.  

Minus 1 star for the way too salty soy sauce.  For some reasons, probably the brand that they use, it is super salty.  Covers the flavor of the fish.  Also, the wasabi is not spicy at all.  You can't taste anything.  

Why I gave 2 stars was b/c the service was really great.  They refilled our tea so many times and they introduce the rolls that we're having, which is pretty nice.

excerpts: Natto - Win just because they had it.
natto.author: Mi M.
natto.review:
I feel bad writing a two-star review as my non-fish-eating Boo brought me here as a treat. Of course, he had the chicken teriyaki bento box and offloaded the salmon and tuna sashimi and the shrimp tempura on me. 

I ordered my usual litmus test sushi food as follows:

Agedashi tofu - mediocre. Over-cooked and lying in a puddle of juice - no bonito, no daikon, a little red ginger. Chipped dish. Needed a spoon too. Fail.

Ikura - good and fresh. Win.

Amaebi - didn't seem too fresh, and they tried to disguise the fact with some tobiko on to. Fried heads were overcooked. Fail.

Sea trout - lovely. Win. (It was the special, so it should have been fresh!)

Natto - Win just because they had it. It was pretty good. 

The salmon and tuna sashimi was okay. Not the freshest I've had, but it was okay. The shrimp tempura was good. 

The service was friendly but a little slow - good thing we weren't in a hurry or anything - but it took them a good 10 minutes to take our order and another 5 minutes to bring drinks. I don't mind slow service if I have a drink in front of me - it was Friday night after all!

I peeked at the bill and it seemed kind of high for what we had.

excerpts: We had some tokiyaki, tempura calamari, Ebi Girl Roll, and I believe the finding Nemo roll.
All of them were good and delicious.
No soy sauce nor wasabi needed when eating it because of the abundant toppings.
The finding Nemo had a slight spicy kick to it and the Ebi Girl has a crunch to it.
The tokiyaki was good but needed some time to cool off before eating and the tempura calamari is tempura calamari.
ebi.author: Donn D.
ebi.review:
Talk about service! My fiance and I wanted some sushi for dinner and picked this place to try out. After walking through the cramped entrance, we signed our names under the wait list. We were 4th down the list and the place were quite packed. We only waited about 5 minutes. Along with that, the waiters and waitress were very quick, but surprisingly pleasant to speak to. I'd say that's top notch for me. There was a mistake in our order and it was quickly taken and replaced without any issues or attitude. For me, the service is 5 stars. The only reason I gave 4 stars in my review is because of the food.

The food was good and delicious, but forgettable. It did the job on satisfying a sushi craving. We had some tokiyaki, tempura calamari, Ebi Girl Roll, and I believe the finding Nemo roll. All of them were good and delicious. No soy sauce nor wasabi needed when eating it because of the abundant toppings. The finding Nemo had a slight spicy kick to it and the Ebi Girl has a crunch to it. The tokiyaki was good but needed some time to cool off before eating and the tempura calamari is tempura calamari. No one should mess that one up.

Anyway, I'd come back here just to satisfy some sushi craving along with the pleasant and expedient service. By the way, the prices may be above average, but not by too much.

Lastly, if the check is paid in cash, there is a 10 percent discount.

excerpts: Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!
A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.
ebi.author: Belle P.
ebi.review: This place is great!  Sushi for days and the kitchen menu is pretty extensive.  Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!  A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.

excerpts:
FOOD & TASTE:
Ordered the Hand Roll Sampler, which comes with 3 rolls your choice of fish.
I went for Hamachi, Salmon, & Salmon Skin.
The Hamachi was super fresh, large pieces of fish, rolled with avocado...
creamy & delicious!
hand roll sampler.author: Lily Y.
hand roll sampler.review:
Out with the bestie making xmas gifts can definitely work up an appetite!  Both craving for some sushi, we decided to stop here based on Peter L.'s suggestion.  Even tho craving, I'm not a big fan of sushi dining on a Monday.  It makes me question their quality... cuz everyone knows the best & the fresh stuff arrives on Thursday, just before the weekend, but don't under estimate this resto.  Thanks to Peteo's suggestion, he's got this one spot on!

FOOD & TASTE:
Ordered the Hand Roll Sampler, which comes with 3 rolls your choice of fish.  I went for Hamachi, Salmon, & Salmon Skin.  The Hamachi was super fresh, large pieces of fish, rolled with avocado... creamy & delicious!  The Salmon was lean, (I usually like mine on the fattier side) was also rolled with avocado, very fresh, went well with the seasoned sushi rice.  

I also ordered Uni nigiri, which was topped with several Ikura.  I'm not a big fan of Ikura, since it's so salty, but it brought out a light "sea" like taste of the buttery uni.  It was so good I almost got another, but at $10.50 an order, I decided to pass. 

Also tried a few other items on the menu... Double Albacore roll, Sushi Sampler, Amaebi, all of which were very tasty!  Mos definitely got my fill of sushi craving.  :-9

CONVENIENCE: **** [Located in West Portal area, on a corner block closer to the Sloat Blvd. side. Street parking or metered spot.  Easy parking on a Monday.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Nothing fancy, just your average resto. Was informed of their upstairs, which is good for groups. Also, first impression reminds me of Korean spot, based menu design.. turns out to be Korean run.]
SERVICE: **** [Nice & friendly, though nothing stellar.]
PRICE: $$  [Be prepared to spend $30 & up per person. It's sushi.]
OVERALL: **** [4-stars... for serving fresh sushi on a Monday with good quality uni.]

Good locals' joint. 
Nuff said.

[#61 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]

excerpts: I coped a spot at the bar and the friendly bartender/ sushi preparer made me a Avocado maki which was delicious and a Spider roll, that though it seemed to be missing it's regular sauce and crab mix was still quite good.
avocado maki.author: Meg T.
avocado maki.review:
Cute little sushi place. Very welcoming, very warm.

I coped a spot at the bar and the friendly bartender/ sushi preparer made me a Avocado maki which was delicious and a Spider roll, that though it seemed to be missing it's regular sauce and crab mix was still quite good.

Their miso was tasty and I saw a sign that they won't serve hot tea to tables with children which I think is a great safety idea.

I'd come back any time.

excerpts: I liked the Looking for Mango roll, but it wasn't outstanding.
What I didn't like is that some of the rolls, like Double Albacore didn't have seaweed in them, you know the Nori, that keeps the rolls from falling apart?
Apparently that wasn't a mistake, that's how they make them
and that's why they fall apart.
Also, too much rice.
I love rice, and I rarely leave any on the plate; in this place, I had to get rid of at least half the rice that they put on their rolls :(
looking for mango roll.author: Anna P.
looking for mango roll.review:
A nice little place in San Francisco. Fuji is my sister's mother-in-law's go-to sushi spot, so we decided to finally give it a try. I liked the Looking for Mango roll, but it wasn't outstanding. What I didn't like is that some of the rolls, like Double Albacore didn't have seaweed in them, you know the Nori, that keeps the rolls from falling apart? Apparently that wasn't a mistake, that's how they make them and that's why they fall apart.
Also, too much rice. I love rice, and I rarely leave any on the plate; in this place, I had to get rid of at least half the rice that they put on their rolls :(

excerpts: we had sake sashimi, looking for mango roll, red dragon roll, and i believe the finding nemo roll.
they were all good, and generously sized rolls.
we also had a couple of large hot sakes and asahis...aside from my sashimi fix, this is primarily what i came here for...especially after a rare hectic work day =
looking for mango roll.author: Ian Q.
looking for mango roll.review:
what can i say about fuji?  obviously, with four stars, i liked it.  it's a small restaurant nestled on a street corner in west portal.  although small, it wasn't cramped...very cozy and welcoming.  the wait staff are attentive, yet far from overwhelming.  we had dinner here on a thursday night, and took advantage of 1/2 off sake & beer!

the food:  we had sake sashimi, looking for mango roll, red dragon roll, and i believe the finding nemo roll.  they were all good, and generously sized rolls.  we also had a couple of large hot sakes and asahis...aside from my sashimi fix, this is primarily what i came here for...especially after a rare hectic work day =P

upon closing time, we left as full, buzzed and happy patrons =)

excerpts: The Looking for Mango roll is a great desert roll.
I always sit at the sushi bar, and the sushi chefs are very social, friendly, and funny.
I went here on Valentines day this year, and they gave me and my friend TWO bottles of sake for free!
Score!
looking for mango roll.author: Jamie J.
looking for mango roll.review: Fuji is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. I eat here at least once a month. I highly recommend the Godzilla roll, which is maguro  wrapped around asparagus with grilled garlic. It is my favorite ever. The Red & White roll is also to die for. It is a spicy tuna roll topped with an amazing salad. The Looking for Mango roll is a great desert roll.  I always sit at the sushi bar, and the sushi chefs are very social, friendly, and funny. I went here on Valentines day this year, and they gave me and my friend TWO bottles of sake for free! Score!

excerpts: We had the Looking For Mango roll and the West 14th roll.
LOVED the West 14th; good level of spice, not too saucy, nice crunchy wakame and tobiko.
looking for mango roll.author: Nicole A.
looking for mango roll.review:
Went for takeout on a Tuesday night, and it was packed. Good sign.

It's a little pricey, but portions are very generous. We had the Looking For Mango roll and the West 14th roll. LOVED the West 14th; good level of spice, not too saucy, nice crunchy wakame and tobiko. I'm not a huge fan of tempura, but the Looking For Mango was very good, too.

I'll probably go back, but probably not that often. I'd like to sit at the sushi bar and just follow the chef's recommendations, assuming I could actually get a seat.

excerpts: The baked scallop roll, liger roll, and baked mussels are my go tos!!!
The fish is super fresh and the customer service is wonderful!
I always leave happy and full
baked scallop roll.author: Michelle H.
baked scallop roll.review:
Yummmmyyyyyy!!! The baked scallop roll, liger roll, and baked mussels are my go tos!!! The fish is super fresh and the customer service is wonderful! I always leave happy and full :) 

Bring cash for that extra 10% off your bill!!!

excerpts: The Godzilla roll was amazing with about 30 pieces of crispy garlic, tempura asparagus, and delicate red tuna.
It was sensual and crunchy.
The service was good too, many times our server and other waitresses checked in to make sure everything was good.
They were friendly and welcoming.
No wait on a Saturday at 6:30 too!
godzilla roll.author: Lisa H.
godzilla roll.review: I'm not sure why this restaurant has low stars, but we were happy customers! Sure, it's on the pricey side, but the rolls are fresh, flavorful, and unique. The mixed tempura was crispy and light, with 3 shrimp, zucchini, carrot, acorn squash, and potato. The philly roll was good, with large pieces of salmon and creamy avocado mixed with chilled cream cheese. The Godzilla roll was amazing with about 30 pieces of crispy garlic, tempura asparagus, and delicate red tuna. It was sensual and crunchy. The service was good too, many times our server and other waitresses checked in to make sure everything was good. They were friendly and welcoming. No wait on a Saturday at 6:30 too!

excerpts:
Godzilla roll
Uni Aji
striped bass
godzilla roll.author: Jeffrey C.
godzilla roll.review:
First time here and man for a local sushi place this place was bangin. Service was great of course very attentive and attractive servers. Nice young hip vibe for west portal which was a great addition because west portal is very uppity and super modern. Nice to come to a place that was homey. 

Recommendations: 
Godzilla roll
Uni Aji
striped bass
And a kanpachi 

This isn't super high end so don't come here with that mentality, but if you love good fish for a good price and a nice conversation with the very interactive sushi chef come on by fuji for your sushi fix!

excerpts: The Godzilla roll, the Lion King, the Mango Roll, the Banana (split?)
roll ...
godzilla roll.author: J. C.
godzilla roll.review:
I've been to this place more times than I can count over the past few years and this review is much delayed. I've been to many sushi places, in more than one state and even more than one country and this place is still my favorite!!

They have fantastic specialty rolls and honestly that is all I can really comment on. The Godzilla roll, the Lion King, the Mango Roll, the Banana (split?) roll ... I could go on.

They also have wonderfully hot tea, great hot edemame (I'm not a fan of it cold), agadashi tofu, sweet potato sticks and of course they round out your dinner with refreshing slices of oranges!

Parking may not be so hot during the rush hour but if you aim for the neighborhood street west of Portal (Wawona) you may have more luck.

excerpts: Dinosaur foot and Godzilla roll are two specials that you shouldn't miss (plus they're fun to say).
godzilla roll.author: spiff e.
godzilla roll.review:
Freshest, best, most creative sushi in the area.  We go here just about every Sunday for dinner.  Dinosaur foot and Godzilla roll are two specials that you shouldn't miss (plus they're fun to say).  Even their non-sushi/sashimi items are good, like their udon, tempura, gyoza and edamame.  Service is pretty good too.  Really not too much to complain about except maybe when we sit upstairs and the service is a tad bit slower.  But then again, if you're in a rush, just insist on a downstairs table.

Oh, just thought of one bad point.  The tables along the wall on the main floor can feel cramped if you have more than one person sitting on either side of the table.  Especially cramped if you're really sensitive about having your personal space.

excerpts: We had the Beef Tataki for the appetizer, Godzilla roll, dinosaur foot
and I asked for the tuna roll because I was afraid I wouldn't like the giant rolls.
Each dish came out really fast and tasted fresh.
The sushi had just the right amount of sauce and wasn't over done with lots of junk on it.
We finished our meal with fried bananas with mango and green tea ice cream.
I finally found a sushi place where I can enjoy the fancy creations, too bad it is in San Francisco
and I live in Southern California.
godzilla roll.author: Vicki G.
godzilla roll.review: I am not the biggest fan of fancy sushi rolls but this place turned out to be the exception for me.  One of my friends is a regular here so she knew exactly what to order. We had the Beef Tataki for the appetizer, Godzilla roll, dinosaur foot and I asked for the tuna roll because I was afraid I wouldn't like the giant rolls. Each dish came out really fast and tasted fresh. The sushi had just the right amount of sauce and wasn't over done with lots of junk on it. We finished our meal with fried bananas with mango and green tea ice cream. I finally found a sushi place where I can enjoy the fancy creations, too bad it is in San Francisco and I live in Southern California.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Godzilla roll, which is maguro  wrapped around asparagus with grilled garlic.
It is my favorite ever.
The Red & White roll is also to die for.
It is a spicy tuna roll topped with an amazing salad.
godzilla roll.author: Jamie J.
godzilla roll.review: Fuji is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. I eat here at least once a month. I highly recommend the Godzilla roll, which is maguro  wrapped around asparagus with grilled garlic. It is my favorite ever. The Red & White roll is also to die for. It is a spicy tuna roll topped with an amazing salad. The Looking for Mango roll is a great desert roll.  I always sit at the sushi bar, and the sushi chefs are very social, friendly, and funny. I went here on Valentines day this year, and they gave me and my friend TWO bottles of sake for free! Score!

excerpts: You've got to try the "Godzilla roll" (cliche name, but new and wonderful tastes!)!
Decent pricing.
I don't recomend the noodle bowls.
They're kinda bland.
Unfortunately, the service here sucks.
The wait staff is thoroughly inefficient (very un-Japanese), making multiple pass-by's with no check in's.
I have to tell you that I was in for lunch.
If I didn't know any better, the sushi chef was laughing at me.
There was an actual moment when I had to ask, "is that roll [that's been sitting on the counter for the past fucking ten minutes] mine?"  and guess what?
It was.
It's really an unfortunate thing.
The food is actually pretty good and the prices are so-so, but goddammit, if it wasn't for the shitty service!
godzilla roll.author: Darkie L.
godzilla roll.review: The fish tastes fresh.  The rolls are farely creative.  You've got to try the "Godzilla roll" (cliche name, but new and wonderful tastes!)!  Decent pricing.  I don't recomend the noodle bowls.  They're kinda bland.  Unfortunately, the service here sucks.  The wait staff is thoroughly inefficient (very un-Japanese), making multiple pass-by's with no check in's. I have to tell you that I was in for lunch.  If I didn't know any better, the sushi chef was laughing at me.  There was an actual moment when I had to ask, "is that roll [that's been sitting on the counter for the past fucking ten minutes] mine?"  and guess what?  It was.  It's really an unfortunate thing.  The food is actually pretty good and the prices are so-so, but goddammit, if it wasn't for the shitty service!

excerpts: It takes over the Godzilla Roll as my favorite dish at Fuji. MMMM.
godzilla roll.author: Erica M.
godzilla roll.review: I went back last week and got the Red and White roll. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! It takes over the Godzilla Roll as my favorite dish at Fuji. MMMM.

excerpts: You must try I'm looking for mango, banana split,godzilla roll, and dinosaur foot.
I reccomend sitting at the bar because you'll get way better service from the sushi chefs then you will from the waitresses.
godzilla roll.author: Sushi K.
godzilla roll.review: I'm not gonna lie to you the service is not good. But the food is amazing. The sushi chefs are are wizards I sware. Some of their combinations sound a little wierd but they taste so good. You must try I'm looking for mango, banana split,godzilla roll, and dinosaur foot. I reccomend sitting at the bar because you'll get way better service from the sushi chefs then you will from the waitresses.

excerpts: Double Albacore roll, Sushi Sampler, Amaebi, all of which were very tasty!
Mos definitely got my fill of sushi craving.
double albacore roll.author: Lily Y.
double albacore roll.review:
Out with the bestie making xmas gifts can definitely work up an appetite!  Both craving for some sushi, we decided to stop here based on Peter L.'s suggestion.  Even tho craving, I'm not a big fan of sushi dining on a Monday.  It makes me question their quality... cuz everyone knows the best & the fresh stuff arrives on Thursday, just before the weekend, but don't under estimate this resto.  Thanks to Peteo's suggestion, he's got this one spot on!

FOOD & TASTE:
Ordered the Hand Roll Sampler, which comes with 3 rolls your choice of fish.  I went for Hamachi, Salmon, & Salmon Skin.  The Hamachi was super fresh, large pieces of fish, rolled with avocado... creamy & delicious!  The Salmon was lean, (I usually like mine on the fattier side) was also rolled with avocado, very fresh, went well with the seasoned sushi rice.  

I also ordered Uni nigiri, which was topped with several Ikura.  I'm not a big fan of Ikura, since it's so salty, but it brought out a light "sea" like taste of the buttery uni.  It was so good I almost got another, but at $10.50 an order, I decided to pass. 

Also tried a few other items on the menu... Double Albacore roll, Sushi Sampler, Amaebi, all of which were very tasty!  Mos definitely got my fill of sushi craving.  :-9

CONVENIENCE: **** [Located in West Portal area, on a corner block closer to the Sloat Blvd. side. Street parking or metered spot.  Easy parking on a Monday.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Nothing fancy, just your average resto. Was informed of their upstairs, which is good for groups. Also, first impression reminds me of Korean spot, based menu design.. turns out to be Korean run.]
SERVICE: **** [Nice & friendly, though nothing stellar.]
PRICE: $$  [Be prepared to spend $30 & up per person. It's sushi.]
OVERALL: **** [4-stars... for serving fresh sushi on a Monday with good quality uni.]

Good locals' joint. 
Nuff said.

[#61 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]

excerpts:
The Godzilla's distinction is based on 1) tempura-fried asparagus 2) sriracha sauce and 3) fried garlic slices 

Double albacore roll is good but last time I had it there was way too much sauce (eel sauce + honey mayo).
double albacore roll.author: Alias A.
double albacore roll.review:
Place is pretty good, with innovative though predictably creamy rolls, and fish outside of tuna could stand to be more fresh.

I tried the Dinosaur Foot based on recommendations.  It was so good - but decadent.  *Fried* leaf, with spicy tuna mixed with *creamy* sauce.  

The Godzilla's distinction is based on 1) tempura-fried asparagus 2) sriracha sauce and 3) fried garlic slices 

Double albacore roll is good but last time I had it there was way too much sauce (eel sauce + honey mayo).  I'd get it on the side if you can.  

Our sushi/sashimi platter was sub-par.  The white fish didn't taste so fresh.  Yellowtail, tuna and salmon were great though.  

3 rolls, 1 sashimi/sushi platter + 1 beer cost $67. 

Nice aura.  Run by Koreans.  

I'll be back.

excerpts: Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites.
The fish quality is great, especially the salmon.
Not to mention the staff is very friendly.
I would definitely recommend.
double albacore roll.author: Corinne S.
double albacore roll.review: Fuji is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant that I have ever been to. I am a regular there, I go 1-3 times a week with my boyfriend and they never disappoint. Their salmon sashimi , bagel rolls, double albacore roll, dinosaur foot, oshitashi and hot tea are all my favorites. The fish quality is great, especially the salmon. Not to mention the staff is very friendly. I would definitely recommend.

excerpts: Their Red & White Roll, Double Albacore Roll, and Scallop Roll are some of the standouts.
Don't miss the gyoza, yakitori and shrimp tempura appetizers.
Fuji's a great find in West Portal.
Also they have a mezzanine level where you can have a huge group if you'd like.
double albacore roll.author: Rebecca D.
double albacore roll.review: I scream sushi, you scream sushi, we all scream sushi. And going to Fuji makes you scream for more. They offer delicious sashimi and nigiri that is extremely fresh and a great cut of fish. Their rolls are inventive and have awesome flavor. Their Red & White Roll, Double Albacore Roll, and Scallop Roll are some of the standouts. Don't miss the gyoza, yakitori and shrimp tempura appetizers. Fuji's a great find in West Portal. Also they have a mezzanine level where you can have a huge group if you'd like.

excerpts: The double albacore roll...ikura with quail egg...spicy tuna roll, hamachi, tuna, salmon...
all exceptional.
Fuji is really great.
They even put toasted rice in my tea when I requested it.
It takes the edge off.
I love this place.
Thanks for reintroducing me to Fuji Miss Michelle.
Muah!
double albacore roll.author: Sherie R.
double albacore roll.review:
We tried this place on a recommendation from a friend. I was disappointed. The only good item we had was the dinosaur foot. I'm sticking with Sushi Bistro- it's waaaay better. Maybe I should keep that to myself though because it's been pretty packed there lately.
*************************************************************************
Update: 7/16/2008. Had the dinosaur foot...LOVED it. The double albacore roll...ikura with quail egg...spicy tuna roll, hamachi, tuna, salmon...all exceptional. Fuji is really great. They even put toasted rice in my tea when I requested it. It takes the edge off. I love this place. Thanks for reintroducing me to Fuji Miss Michelle. Muah!

excerpts: The double albacore roll is my favorite roll, but I usually order sashimi and nigiri.
yum!
double albacore roll.author: Claudia M.
double albacore roll.review: I love this place! Great sushi, hardly ever a wait for a table and great service. It also has none of the pretensions of the hipper places and I think it is just as good. The double albacore roll is my favorite roll, but I usually order sashimi and nigiri. yum!

excerpts: Butterfly roll, red and white roll, Volcano roll...
AMAZEBALLS.
Super fresh.
Even the salad is good.
If i was rich i would eat here everyday, yes EVERYDAY.
red and white roll.author: Ashley B.
red and white roll.review: This is the best sushi I have ever tasted. Butterfly roll, red and white roll, Volcano roll... AMAZEBALLS. Super fresh. Even the salad is good. If i was rich i would eat here everyday, yes EVERYDAY.

excerpts: Their red and white roll is definitely one of a kind.
Salad within a roll?
Yummy!
I also liked their spicy roll with the chili pepper on top
red and white roll.author: Jenny T.
red and white roll.review:
Found my new favorite restaurants in West Portal!

Love their rolls, they're pretty creative, and are beautifully presented. Their red and white roll is definitely one of a kind. Salad within a roll? Yummy! I also liked their spicy roll with the chili pepper on top (forgot what it's called).

Overall, great selection of rolls. I went with a party of 6 so we got to try alot of different ones and we were never disappointed.

Only thing is I thought the rolls were a little on the pricey side.

excerpts: my favorite is red and white roll, and dinner box 3
red and white roll.author: chihiro i.
red and white roll.review:
this is one of my favorite sushi joint to go.

my favorite is red and white roll, and dinner box 3 i think, the one with chicken yakitori and tempura, eggplant dengaku, california roll, salad, rice, and misosoup. aand of course with a cold one. mmmm.

Their rolls are awesome. I just looove the creativeness and oh they taste so good. my roommate never eat sushi, but she liked their rolls, that means a lot.

excerpts: I went back last week and got the Red and White roll.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
red and white roll.author: Erica M.
red and white roll.review: I went back last week and got the Red and White roll. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! It takes over the Godzilla Roll as my favorite dish at Fuji. MMMM.

excerpts: The red and white roll is amazing but they also have really amazing nightly specials.
red and white roll.author: sarah s.
red and white roll.review: One of my favorite sushi joints! They have the best miso soup.. and I'm very picky about my miso soup.. The red and white roll is amazing but they also have really amazing nightly specials.

excerpts: hamachi Kama, and the liger roll.
The prices here aren't cheap
but it's definitely worth the money.
Their portion sizes are huge and the quality is always up to par.
They do get pretty packed esp on weekends
but I've never had an issue with the service.
All the staff are very friendly and accommodating, they seem to really care about their customers and the quality of their food.
It's always a good experience and a fun time, thank you fuji for reopening !!
liger roll.author: Edison P.
liger roll.review: This is hands down my favorite sushi spot in the city. They have many different selections of fish that are always very fresh. The toro and uni here never disappoints. Fuji has a large sake and beer selection to go with their amazing sushi. Some of my favorite dishes are the Gindara Miso (miso marinated black cod) hamachi Kama, and the liger roll. The prices here aren't cheap but it's definitely worth the money. Their portion sizes are huge and the quality is always up to par. They do get pretty packed esp on weekends but I've never had an issue with the service. All the staff are very friendly and accommodating, they seem to really care about their customers and the quality of their food. It's always a good experience and a fun time, thank you fuji for reopening !!

The fish is super fresh and the customer service is wonderful!
I always leave happy and full
liger roll.author: Michelle H.

Yummmmyyyyyy!!! The baked scallop roll, liger roll, and baked mussels are my go tos!!! The fish is super fresh and the customer service is wonderful! I always leave happy and full :) 

Bring cash for that extra 10% off your bill!!!

The chefs u can see making sushi there's two and they just kind of take their time and talk to each other .
iv always waited over 30 minutes here to get one to two sushi rolls .
its wayyyy too long .

excerpts: Salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, while the liger roll had harmonious flavors (the green onion wasn't overwhelming or anything).
The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it!
Will come back :)
liger roll.author: Kevin T.
liger roll.review: Went with my sister during their lunch break, but they still accepted us! Very social and nice workers that kept us company at the sushi bar. In addition, the food was very very good. Salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, while the liger roll had harmonious flavors (the green onion wasn't overwhelming or anything). The sashimi salad was very fresh too, highly recommend it! Will come back :)

excerpts: You have to try their liger roll and spicy crunch roll!
Would definitely come back and recommend this place to friends and family!
liger roll.author: Grace T.
liger roll.review: Excellent service! The servers were extremely friendly and attentive. The food was also very good! You have to try their liger roll and spicy crunch roll! Would definitely come back and recommend this place to friends and family!

excerpts: I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll.
The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends.
I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love.
Be prepared for a true carb feast.
I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place!

It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed!
Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.
liger roll.author: Stephanie Y.
liger roll.review: Being born and raised in Seattle, I have always been blessed with great seafood -- it's practically everywhere. But ever since I've moved to San Francisco, I've been constantly on the hunt to find a new sushi restaurant that I could call my go-to. Didn't expect to find it here in West Portal! Fuji, located in a small, kitschy neighborhood, is the place that can cater to all your sushi needs. I always start off with the sashimi sampler and finish solid with the Finding Nemo and Liger roll. The fish is very fresh among the other sushi restaurants I've tried in the city, and the rolls are big enough to share among friends. I've also tried the Rock&Roll, which has a thicker layer of rice on the outside that I love. Be prepared for a true carb feast. I've noticed that most of the reviews teeters between a 3 and 4 star, but don't underestimate this place! It's true, weekends tend to get pretty packed here, so I've noticed that sushi orders tend to take a little longer when its near peak hours, but if you're down for the wait, you won't be disappointed! Other than that, service is great, and I would highly recommend anyone to try this place out.

excerpts: The Liger roll is GREAT!
Fantastic service and excellent rolls.
Food it good and the service is consistent.
liger roll.author: M A.
liger roll.review: This is my absolute favorite sushi spot. The Liger roll is GREAT! Fantastic service and excellent rolls. Food it good and the service is consistent.

excerpts: the liger roll came and
it was extremely well presented.
the honey and wasabi mayo combo on plate is such a fabulous contrast!
the portions were filling and the fish was fresh.
liger roll.author: Lucy W.
liger roll.review:
i don't believe that rolls are a true representation of what japanese cuisine has to offer.  japanese cuisine (to me) is supposed to be modest, simple and reflect the purity of the food item that you are about to consume (sashimi, broiled mackeral, etc.) 

however, with the explosion of westernized influences on japanese cuisine, rolls are extremely popular in the US.  and to me, if it's made right, it can be a fantastic explosion of flavors and textures that our palatte can take on at once.

i believe that of all the west portal sushi establishments, this place does it right.  on a thursday nght, all of the tables were packed.  service can be a bit slow, but i barely noticed it since i was partaking in their thursday night special of 1/2 off sake and beer (and i'm a big sucker for discounted drinks).

the liger roll came and it was extremely well presented.  the honey and wasabi mayo combo on plate is such a fabulous contrast!  the portions were filling and the fish was fresh.  the saba donburi is pretty on point as well.  they serve the mackeral on a huge white platter, and while you may think that it's odd to serve it on a huge plate, i appreciated it because it allowed the mackeral to stand on it's own and shine, rather than drown in a sea of red in the typical bento boxes.

a bit expensive for sushi, but it's a welcome and comforting change from the party-filled atmosphere at other establishments in the neighborhood.  great place to go if you've got kids or want to have a conversation with someone without yelling at the top of your lungs.  and remember, you can't drink if you damage your vocal cords!

excerpts: Having said all that, the spicy crunch roll, the Liger roll, and others were quite quite good.
I'd definitely go back.
liger roll.author: SF Y.
liger roll.review: I'd give it a 5, but the poke (poki?) was really overpriced and subpar.  Not much fish, too much vegetation, and not that flavorful.  Having said all that, the spicy crunch roll, the Liger roll, and others were quite quite good.  I'd definitely go back.

excerpts: The liger roll is great if you like saucy rolls.
Also a big fan of the dragon foot roll.
liger roll.author: elissa w.
liger roll.review:
yum yum. we ordered a bunch of the special rolls, sashimi and sake bombs. not sure if the rolls were amazing because I was drunk or it really was delicious.

The liger roll is great if you like saucy rolls. Also a big fan of the dragon foot roll. My friends are really into sashimi and thought the rainbow trout was 'to die for.' we also got some raw oysters which were pretty good.

this place was good, we also managed to rack up a $200 bill between 4 people.

excerpts: If the Firecracker was too guilty and calorific for you, then the Finding Nemo roll will cleanse your palate with its fresh salmon taste.
finding nemo roll.author: Joanne K.
finding nemo roll.review:
Fuji is a small, cozy Japanese restaurant. If you're here for good sushi, try some of the special rolls, including Finding Nemo and the Firecracker.  Between my friend and me, we were full after four rolls (Finding Nemo, Firecracker, Futo Maki, Baked Scallop). 

We both felt the baked scallop was generous with the scallops but way too heavy on the creamy sauce (is it mayo?), which overwhelmed the natural taste of the scallops and sushi itself. We loved the Firecracker, which was lightly fried with tempura batter and had delicious salmon inside. If the Firecracker was too guilty and calorific for you, then the Finding Nemo roll will cleanse your palate with its fresh salmon taste.

The waiters were especially attentive and nice, so two thumbs up for good customer service.

excerpts:
The OK:
Finding nemo roll - spicy tuna
no the inside, salmon and avocado on the outside.
finding nemo roll.author: Michelle L.
finding nemo roll.review:
Delicious Japanese restaurant, but a little pricier, and prepare to wait for your food!

Favorite items were:
Korean style Chirashi: nom nom nom! Korean style basically means the fish is chopped up smaller and it came with a ton of lettuce. I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces. Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor! Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside... hamachi on the outside! No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat. Creamy avocado and sweet sauce was super flavorful as well

The OK:
Finding nemo roll - spicy tuna no the inside, salmon and avocado on the outside. decent, but not my favorite!!

Again - it takes them a while to serve you here. They seemed to have a TON of togo orders, with only 2 waitresses and 2 sushi chefs. It wasn't too crowded... but it seemed that every aspect of service dragged on.

Come here if you don't mind the wait!!

excerpts: I highly recommend ordering the Dino Foot, Liger and the Finding Nemo Roll.
The presentation was on point and everything full of flavor.
Sushi craving satisfied!
finding nemo roll.author: Ashley S.
finding nemo roll.review: Love this place! The food is fresh and delicious. My second time around I discovered some new rolls that I absolutely love. I highly recommend ordering the Dino Foot, Liger and the Finding Nemo Roll. The presentation was on point and everything full of flavor. Sushi craving satisfied!

excerpts: We had some tokiyaki, tempura calamari, Ebi Girl Roll, and I believe the finding Nemo roll.
All of them were good and delicious.
No soy sauce nor wasabi needed when eating it because of the abundant toppings.
The finding Nemo had a slight spicy kick to it and the Ebi Girl has a crunch to it.
The tokiyaki was good but needed some time to cool off before eating and the tempura calamari is tempura calamari.
finding nemo roll.author: Donn D.
finding nemo roll.review:
Talk about service! My fiance and I wanted some sushi for dinner and picked this place to try out. After walking through the cramped entrance, we signed our names under the wait list. We were 4th down the list and the place were quite packed. We only waited about 5 minutes. Along with that, the waiters and waitress were very quick, but surprisingly pleasant to speak to. I'd say that's top notch for me. There was a mistake in our order and it was quickly taken and replaced without any issues or attitude. For me, the service is 5 stars. The only reason I gave 4 stars in my review is because of the food.

The food was good and delicious, but forgettable. It did the job on satisfying a sushi craving. We had some tokiyaki, tempura calamari, Ebi Girl Roll, and I believe the finding Nemo roll. All of them were good and delicious. No soy sauce nor wasabi needed when eating it because of the abundant toppings. The finding Nemo had a slight spicy kick to it and the Ebi Girl has a crunch to it. The tokiyaki was good but needed some time to cool off before eating and the tempura calamari is tempura calamari. No one should mess that one up.

Anyway, I'd come back here just to satisfy some sushi craving along with the pleasant and expedient service. By the way, the prices may be above average, but not by too much.

Lastly, if the check is paid in cash, there is a 10 percent discount.

excerpts: I got the oshotashi, dinosaur foot and the finding nemo roll.
Everything was great food wise.
The service could be a little better...
But my server was very attentive and nice.
One of my favorite places for dinner!
finding nemo roll.author: Taylor R.
finding nemo roll.review:
I love this place!
I got the oshotashi, dinosaur foot and the finding nemo roll. Everything was great food wise.
The service could be a little better... But my server was very attentive and nice.
One of my favorite places for dinner!

excerpts: I ordered the Finding Nemo roll and Salmon Skin hand roll.
The Finding Nemo was falling apart before I even picked it up.
I also noticed how much SMALLER it was this time around...
two pieces of the roll last night would have equaled to ONE piece of a sushi roll from the Fuji that I used to love.
As for the salmon skin hand roll....the key ingredient to the salmon skin hand roll is the crunchiness of the salmon skin.
It wasn't crunchy at all
finding nemo roll.author: Angel A.
finding nemo roll.review:
Just came here last night...the quality of the sushi is declining fast.

I ordered the Finding Nemo roll and Salmon Skin hand roll. The Finding Nemo was falling apart before I even picked it up. I also noticed how much SMALLER it was this time around...two pieces of the roll last night would have equaled to ONE piece of a sushi roll from the Fuji that I used to love. As for the salmon skin hand roll....the key ingredient to the salmon skin hand roll is the crunchiness of the salmon skin. It wasn't crunchy at all and it was oily and soggy.

My Mom ordered the dinner bento box with the grilled hamachi/yellowtail. It was tasteless, rough, and not grilled well. A FAR cry from the crispy, well-grilled hamachi that used to come with dinner boxes before.

Also - did you guys change chefs? I noticed the chefs this time around were a lot younger

excerpts: Also the finding nemo roll is too delicious to pass.
The only bad thing about this place is the quality of the service.
The waiter never came to check up on us and fill our water glasses.
Other than that the food was yummy!
finding nemo roll.author: Andrea M.
finding nemo roll.review: Great little sushi place in San Francisco! I enjoyed the 3 for $12.00 sushi hand rolls. Also the finding nemo roll is too delicious to pass. The only bad thing about this place is the quality of the service. The waiter never came to check up on us and fill our water glasses. Other than that the food was yummy!

excerpts: Finding Nemo Roll:
The most amazing roll I have ever had in my ENTIRE life,
yeah
you better believe it.

Spicy tuna roll topped with avacado and salmon drizzled with eel sauce...yummm
2.)
Lion King Roll: Delicious!
Even though it is cooked fish.
Firecracker: If you want something spicy this is the roll for you!
Double Albacore: Yummy too!
finding nemo roll.author: Annika K.
finding nemo roll.review:
Fuji Sushi is the best!
1.) Finding Nemo Roll: The most amazing roll I have ever had in my ENTIRE life, yeah you better believe it. Spicy tuna roll topped with avacado and salmon drizzled with eel sauce...yummm
2.) Lion King Roll: Delicious! Even though it is cooked fish.
3.) Firecracker: If you want something spicy this is the roll for you!
4.) Double Albacore: Yummy too!

excerpts: There are a lot of rolls and it's quite inventive, w/ some names like Linger Roll and Finding Nemo roll, but they all taste only ok.
finding nemo roll.author: AhLin C.
finding nemo roll.review:
when you've had really good sushi, nothing can really top it.  After Oyaji, I found Fuji really lacking.  Their toro was good, but not as good.  Their ocean trout is good, and again, not as good.  

There are a lot of rolls and it's quite inventive, w/ some names like Linger Roll and Finding Nemo roll, but they all taste only ok.  

Minus 1 star for the way too salty soy sauce.  For some reasons, probably the brand that they use, it is super salty.  Covers the flavor of the fish.  Also, the wasabi is not spicy at all.  You can't taste anything.  

Why I gave 2 stars was b/c the service was really great.  They refilled our tea so many times and they introduce the rolls that we're having, which is pretty nice.

excerpts: we had sake sashimi, looking for mango roll, red dragon roll, and i believe the finding nemo roll.
they were all good, and generously sized rolls.
we also had a couple of large hot sakes and asahis...aside from my sashimi fix, this is primarily what i came here for...especially after a rare hectic work day =
finding nemo roll.author: Ian Q.
finding nemo roll.review:
what can i say about fuji?  obviously, with four stars, i liked it.  it's a small restaurant nestled on a street corner in west portal.  although small, it wasn't cramped...very cozy and welcoming.  the wait staff are attentive, yet far from overwhelming.  we had dinner here on a thursday night, and took advantage of 1/2 off sake & beer!

the food:  we had sake sashimi, looking for mango roll, red dragon roll, and i believe the finding nemo roll.  they were all good, and generously sized rolls.  we also had a couple of large hot sakes and asahis...aside from my sashimi fix, this is primarily what i came here for...especially after a rare hectic work day =P

upon closing time, we left as full, buzzed and happy patrons =)

excerpts: We also shared the Finding Nemo roll, a fairly basic (but quite good) salmon and avocado roll.
finding nemo roll.author: Greg H.
finding nemo roll.review:
The food was good, prices fair and atmosphere fine.  What set Fuji apart for me was some of the rolls.

My wife and I shared the Volcano roll (which included tempura shrimp, spicy tuna, cucumber, spicy sauce, tobiko and I don't recall what else).  It was nicely spicy.  We also shared the Finding Nemo roll, a fairly basic (but quite good) salmon and avocado roll.

The moment I saw the Banana Split roll on the menu I had to order it.  Tempura shrimp, cucumber, spicy crabmeat, and avocado wrapped in slices of banana and topped with eel sauce and tempura crumbs.  It was incredibly unique and worked pretty well.  It wasn't amazing, but I would definitely order it frequently.  The banana was actually just about perfect, fragrant and ripe, but not over ripe.

Only two small negatives - but they are really small. We ordered the tempura shrimp for my 3 year old - which comes with the miso soup.  There were only 3 or 4 small cubes of tofu in the soup, wish there'd been more.  Also, my son didn't really care for any of the tempura veggies that came with the shrimp, but carrot and potato are probably the only ones he would like.

excerpts:
The rolls are unique, my favorite is the No Problem Roll ;-) 
My boyfriend (who is not a "sushi-lover") loved the dinner box that came with rice, salad, miso soup, goyza, shrimp & vegetable tempura, chicken teriyaki, and shashimi --- all for a reasonable price! 
We both loved this place and will come back very soon!
no problem roll.author: Frances J.
no problem roll.review:
I have lived several blocks away from West Portal for 22 years. 
I am kicking myself for not trying Fuji earlier! 
The staff is extremely friendly. 
The rolls are unique, my favorite is the No Problem Roll ;-) 
My boyfriend (who is not a "sushi-lover") loved the dinner box that came with rice, salad, miso soup, goyza, shrimp & vegetable tempura, chicken teriyaki, and shashimi --- all for a reasonable price! 
We both loved this place and will come back very soon!

excerpts: The Cherry Blossom roll I got, had so much rice and rolled with tasteless and OLD tuna fish.
Salmon was chewy and with layer of fat.
Generally when you smell the fish on your plate it is a big NO NO
, I could smell the fish the moment plate landed on y table.
I literally took two bites and left my food at the restaurants.
Waiter was nice but not professional enough to ask me why I left my plate full of food!!!!
My other order was veggie gyoza
cherry blossom roll.author: Anna S.
cherry blossom roll.review:
The Cherry Blossom roll I got, had so much rice and rolled with tasteless and OLD tuna fish. Salmon was chewy and with layer of fat. Generally when you smell the fish on your plate it is a big NO NO, I could smell the fish the moment plate landed on y table. I literally took two bites and left my food at the restaurants. Waiter was nice but not professional enough to ask me why I left my plate full of food!!!!
My other order was veggie gyoza and it was good.

I would also question cleanliness at Fuji's..  The tables are sticky and the chairs are sticky & dirty. Seriously, this place hasn't been cleaned or maintained well.  

Food is mediocre at best.
I don't consider myself a picky eater but this restaurant is now off the list.

excerpts: I had the cherry blossom roll, the maguro was cut a little thick for my taste but the quality was great.
I think their miso soup was one of the best I've had and the atmosphere was really cozy, staff very friendly and fun.
This will definately be my regular sushi spot from now on.
cherry blossom roll.author: Perri B.
cherry blossom roll.review: I had the cherry blossom roll, the maguro was cut a little thick for my taste but the quality was great. I think their miso soup was one of the best I've had and the atmosphere was really cozy, staff very friendly and fun. This will definately be my regular sushi spot from now on.

excerpts: The special banana split roll was cold and small and didn't taste as good as before the closure (for safety concerns).
This used to be a neighborhood fave, but now I'll probably never come here again.
banana split roll.author: Athos K.
banana split roll.review: Really disappointing reopening.  The service is terrible - they're either understaffed or just too slow. We ordered a lot of sashimi:  most of it was bland, some of it was actually kind of bad.  The ankimo was terrible. The special banana split roll was cold and small and didn't taste as good as before the closure (for safety concerns).  This used to be a neighborhood fave, but now I'll probably never come here again.

excerpts: I recommend the snowy roll if you enjoy crab and their combination dinners are pretty large.
Always come here when I feel like Japanese!!!
snowy roll.author: Preston H.
snowy roll.review: Great food great service top quality!!!!! Thanks Fuji for always delivering those dank eats!!!!  I recommend the snowy roll if you enjoy crab and their combination dinners are pretty large.  Always come here when I feel like Japanese!!!

excerpts: Butterfly roll, red and white roll, Volcano roll...
AMAZEBALLS.
Super fresh.
Even the salad is good.
If i was rich i would eat here everyday, yes EVERYDAY.
butterfly roll.author: Ashley B.
butterfly roll.review: This is the best sushi I have ever tasted. Butterfly roll, red and white roll, Volcano roll... AMAZEBALLS. Super fresh. Even the salad is good. If i was rich i would eat here everyday, yes EVERYDAY.

excerpts: The Fuji Sushi Assortment came with so many pieces of sushi I could finish it.
Historically I think that is a first for me!
I usually clean my plate and those of surrounding diners when I have sushi.
It was only $22!
SUPER DEAL!
Well actually it didn't cost me a dime so SUPER AWESOME FANTASTIC DEAL!
The one thing I didn't care for was their agedashi tofu appetizer but if you are going to screw up something in a Japanese restaurant
I'm glad it's the tofu and not the fish.
I would definitely hit these guys up again...even if it was on my own dime.
fuji sushi assortment.author: Jill D.
fuji sushi assortment.review:
On yet another drug rep lunch dime we ate here. I have to report I was shocked to find such decent sushi after my abysmal experiences at Kamakura and the dearth of good West Portal restaurants in general.  You really get your money's worth here.   The Fuji Sushi Assortment came with so many pieces of sushi I could finish it.  Historically I think that is a first for me!  I usually clean my plate and those of surrounding diners when I have sushi.  It was only $22!  SUPER DEAL! Well actually it didn't cost me a dime so SUPER AWESOME FANTASTIC DEAL! The one thing I didn't care for was their agedashi tofu appetizer but if you are going to screw up something in a Japanese restaurant I'm glad it's the tofu and not the fish.
I would definitely hit these guys up again...even if it was on my own dime.

excerpts: I ordered the Fuji sushi assortment the first time and then the Chef's Choice sushi dish the second time.
Both were very good and had  a nice variety of fish; which was very fresh and melted in my mouth when I ate it.
The portions are pretty good too.
I know sushi dishes can be kind of small but these pieces were big and i felt full after finishing my dish.
The dinner and lunch boxes my friends ordered also had nice portions.
It's a little pricey but it's worth the money.
Recommended if you're looking for japanese food around west portal!
fuji sushi assortment.author: Austin C.
fuji sushi assortment.review: I've been here twice and I have to say that this is a great sushi place. I ordered the Fuji sushi assortment the first time and then the Chef's Choice sushi dish the second time. Both were very good and had  a nice variety of fish; which was very fresh and melted in my mouth when I ate it. The portions are pretty good too. I know sushi dishes can be kind of small but these pieces were big and i felt full after finishing my dish. The dinner and lunch boxes my friends ordered also had nice portions. It's a little pricey but it's worth the money. Recommended if you're looking for japanese food around west portal!

excerpts: This review is only for my Korean style Chirashi bowl, their service, and their price.
If you know what a Korean style chirashi bowl is, then sans perila/seasame leaf, this was legit.
If you know what a Korean style chirashi bowl is, then sans perila/seasame leaf, this was legit.
chirashi.author: S Y.
chirashi.review:
I had bookmarked Fuji to try for awhile now, and I'm bummed it took me so long to try it. This review is only for my Korean style Chirashi bowl, their service, and their price.

If you know what a Korean style chirashi bowl is, then sans perila/seasame leaf, this was legit.  Tons of quality sashimi, lots of veggies, and small bowl of rice. It made me miss my moms "hwe dup bap". I'd go back in a heartbeat just to get this dish.  My bf ordered California, Spider, and green dragon rolls and he said it was good. But nothing for him to say stellar, but he'd go back for sure.

Service was little slow. There were 2 sushi men making the rolls, and at least one or two back kitchen team, but one server. Granted we went close to 2pm, or there was a waitress shortage, service could've been better.  The waitress was sweet, kind, fast. Still, no way for her to cover the entire restaurant.

Price was reasonable. It's not a deal of the century, but it was sf price tag.

I am not sure of all of low reviews, I didn't read it, I don't think it's going to change my opinion much about now our regular spot.
